reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and ball-milled with zirconia balls in nylon jars for 12 hours.
Additional 2 wt% PbO was introduced for compensating volatilization during sintering process.
After drying at 120°C, powders were calcined at 900°C for 4 hours and re-milled for another 6 hours.
Dried powders were mixed with polyvinyl alcohol binder and sieved through screen mesh.
Particles were pressed into pellets with diameter of 12 mm and thickness around 1.2 mm under uniaxial pressure of 15 MPa.
Green pellets were fired at 500°C for 2 hours for binder burn-out.
Specimens were sintered at 1190-1250°C for 1 hour.
Cooling process was controlled at 3°C/min till 600°C to prevent ceramics from cracking.
Natural cooling without quenching was performed below 600°C.
Sintered pellets were coated with silver paste on both surfaces and dried at 120°C for 30 minutes.
Samples were polarized in silicon oil at 150°C with DC electric field up to 4 kV/mm for 30 minutes.
test_steps: Weighed raw materials (PbO, K2CO3, Nb2O5, Ta2O5) according to stoichiometric ratio.
Ball-milled raw materials with zirconia balls in nylon jars for 12 h.
Introduced additional 2 wt% of PbO for compensating volatilization during sintering.
Dried the powders at 120 °C.
Calcined the powders at 900 °C for 4 h.
Re-milled the calcined powders for another 6 h.
Mixed the dried powders with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Sieved the mixture through a screen mesh.
Pressed the particles into pellets with a diameter of 12 mm and thickness around 1.2 mm under uniaxial pressure of 15 MPa.
Fired the green pellets at 500 °C for 2 h for binder burn-out.
Sintered all specimens at 1190–1250 °C for 1 h (optimal sintering temperature determined to be 1230 °C).
Controlled cooling process at 3 °C/min till 600 °C to prevent cracking.
Performed natural cooling without quenching below 600 °C.
Coated sintered pellets with silver paste on both surfaces.
Dried coated pellets at 120 °C for 30 min to solidify electrodes.
Polarized samples in silicon oil at 150 °C with a DC electric field up to 4 kV/mm for 30 min using a high-voltage polarization system.
For annealing test, polarized samples were heated from room temperature to different annealing temperatures at 3 °C/min and held for 0.5 h, then naturally cooled down to room temperature.
For heat-treated samples, they were heated to 350 °C at 3 °C/min and held for 2 h, then naturally cooled down to room temperature before the annealing process.

reference_steps: Raw chemicals were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and ball-milled for 12 hours with ethyl alcohol as medium.
Mixture was dried and calcined at 1250°C for 2 hours with heating rate of 5°C/min.
Calcined powder was ball-milled again in ethanol for 12 hours and dried at 90°C for 3 hours.
Mixture was pressed into pellets with diameter of 8 mm using 5 wt% PVA as binder.
Pellets were heated at 500°C for 5 hours to volatilize the PVA.
Pellets were sintered at 1450°C for 4 hours in air.
All samples were aged at room temperature for one week before testing.
Samples were coated with Ag electrodes on both sides and heated at 700°C for 30 minutes.
Samples were poled in silicone oil bath at 100°C and cooled to 0°C under DC field of 3 kV/mm.
test_steps: Raw chemicals (BaCO3, TiO2, HfO2, Fe2O3) were weighed according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Ball-milled for 12 h with ethyl alcohol as the medium.
The mixture was dried.
Calcined at 1250 ℃ for 2 h with a heating rate of 5 ℃/min.
The calcined powder was ball-milled again in ethanol for 12 h.
Dried at 90 ℃ for 3 h.
Pressed into pellets with a diameter of 8 mm using 5 wt% PVA as a binder.
Heated at 500 ℃ for 5 h to volatilize the PVA.
The pellets were sintered at 1450 ℃ for 4 h in air.
Samples were coated with Ag electrodes on both sides and heated at 700 ℃ for 30 min.
All samples were poled in a silicone oil bath at 100 ℃ and then cooled to 0 ℃ under a DC field of 3 kV/mm.

reference_steps: All raw materials were dried in oven at approximately 120°C for 5 hours.
Weighed raw materials were mixed by ball milling for 12 hours with ethanol as medium.
Raw materials slurry was dried in oven.
Dried raw materials were calcined at 850°C for 2 hours to obtain object composition.
Calcined powder was secondly ball milled for another 12 hours to reduce particle size.
Calcined powder was dried in oven and granulated by passing through 80 mesh sieve.
5 wt% PVA aqueous solution was added as binder (approximately 10 wt% of powder mass).
Disk shape green bodies were pressed under uniaxial pressing.
Green bodies were heated to 800°C for 2 hours to remove binder.
Green bodies were sintered at 1140-1180°C for 2 hours.
As-sintered ceramic disks were polished and heated to 1100°C for 1 hour then removed directly from furnace for rapid cooling.
Silver electrodes were prepared on both surfaces of disks.
Ceramic samples were poled under electrical field of 4-7 MV/m for 5 minutes at room temperature.
test_steps: All raw materials were dried in an oven at approximately 120°C for 5 hours.
The weighed raw materials were mixed by ball milling for 12 hours with ethanol as a medium.
The dried raw materials were calcined at 850°C for 2 hours to obtain the object composition of NBBT100x ceramics.
The calcined powder was secondly ball milled for another 12 hours to reduce the particle size.
After dried in an oven, the calcined powder was granulated by passing through 80 mesh sieve.
Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) aqueous solution (5 wt. %) was added as a binder (approximately 10 wt.% of the powder mass).
Before sintering, the green bodies were heated to 800°C for 2 hours to remove the binder.
NBBT100x green bodies were sintered at 1140°C-1180°C for 2 hours.
The polished ceramic disks were heated to 1100°C for 1 hour and then removed directly from the furnace to air for a rapid cooling (quenched ceramics, QS).
Ceramics normally cooled in furnace are labeled as NS.
Additional Sr or Bi was added before the calcination process for Sr- and Bi-modified NBBT6 ceramics.

family.reference: Aurivillius-type ceramics or BLSF or CaBi2Nb2O9 or CBNO

reference_steps: Raw materials were precisely weighed according to stoichiometric ratios.
Materials were ball milled for 8 hours using ethanol as dispersion medium.
Mixed raw materials were dried and calcined at 850°C for 4 hours.
Calcined powder was ground again under same condition.
Obtained powder was dried, ground, and compressed into disk with diameter of 8 mm under pressure of 250 MPa.
Ceramics were sintered at 1100°C for 4 hours.
For electrical property testing, both sides were polished and coated with silver or platinum electrodes.
Samples were immersed in silicone oil at 180°C and electric field of 150-200 kV/cm was applied for 30 minutes for polarization.
test_steps: Raw materials (CaCO3, Li2CO3, CeO2, Bi2O3, Nb2O5, WO3, MoO3) were precisely weighed according to stoichiometric ratios.
Ball milling for 8 h using ethanol as the dispersion medium.
Mixed raw materials were dried.
Calcined at 850 °C for 4 h.
Obtained powder was dried.
Ground the powder.
Compressed into a disk with a diameter of 8 mm under a pressure of 250 MPa.
Sintering at a temperature of 1100 °C for 4 h.

reference_steps: KICET-PZT8 piezoelectric powder, paraffin wax, ethylene-vinyl-acetate, and polystyrene were uniformly mixed using heated double planetary mixer.
Mixture was heated and extruded using twin-screw extruder to prepare piezoelectric feedstock.
Preform of 1-3 type composite was fabricated using ceramic injection molding machine with prepared feedstock.
PZT composite preform was sintered at 1250°C for 2 hours.
Polymer (EPOTEK 301) was poured into sintered preform.
Polymer-poured specimens were cured at 80°C for 12 hours.
Final cured specimens were machined into shapes optimized by simulation.
Room-temperature-curing silver electrodes were applied to machined specimens.
Polarization was performed by applying electric field of 2.5 kV/mm for 20 minutes in silicone oil bath at 120°C.
test_steps: Prepare feedstock consisting of KICET-PZT8 piezoelectric powder, paraffin wax, and ethylene-vinyl-acetate.
Fabricate the 1-3 type composite preform using a Ceramic Injection Molding (CIM) machine.
Sinter the PZT composite preform at 1250 °C for 2 hours.
Pour polymer (301, EPOTEK) into the sintered preform.
Cure the polymer-poured specimens at 80 °C for 12 hours.
Machine the cured specimens into optimized shapes.
Apply room-temperature-curing silver electrodes to the machined specimens.
Perform polarization by applying an electric field of 2.5 kV/mm for 20 minutes in a silicone oil bath at 120 °C.

method.test: Solid-phase reaction and two-step spark plasma sintering

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and mixed by ball-milling with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 hours.
Dried mixtures were calcined at 850°C for 2 hours.
Additional 24-hour ball-milling was performed under same conditions.
Synthesized powders were ground and granulated with PVA binder.
Powders were pressed into discs measuring 12 mm diameter and 1 mm thickness under pressure of 150 MPa.
PVA was removed by heating at 650°C.
Green samples were sintered in muffle furnace at 1150°C for 3 hours (CBN) or 1100-1140°C for 3 hours (Tm-substituted CBN).
For textured ceramics: powders were placed in graphite die and heated to 990°C for 3 minutes under 60 MPa load using SPS.
Block was deformed in larger graphite die at 1130°C for 5 minutes under 40 MPa load.
Samples were annealed in muffle furnace at 1000°C for 4 hours in air.
Test surfaces were plated with heat-resistant electrodes and sintered at 570°C for 30 minutes (silver) or 950°C for 30 minutes (platinum).
Samples were poled under DC electric field of 12-15 kV/mm at 180°C for 15 minutes.
test_steps: Raw materials (CaCO3, Bi2O3, Nb2O5, and Tm2O3) were weighed according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Raw materials were mixed by ball-milling with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 hours.
The mixtures were dried.
The dried mixtures were calcined at 850 °C for 2 hours.
An additional 24-hour ball-milling was performed under the same conditions.
The synthesized CBN-100xTm powders were ground and granulated with a polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
The granulated powders were pressed into discs measuring 12 mm in diameter and 1 mm in thickness under a pressure of 150 MPa.
PVA was removed by heating at 650 °C.

Green samples were sintered in a muffle furnace: CaBi2Nb2O9 ceramics were sintered at 1150 °C for 3 hours, and thulium-substituted CBN ceramics were sintered at temperatures ranging from 1100 to 1140 °C for 3 hours (for non-textured samples).

For textured ceramics, CBN-100xTm powders were placed into a graphite die (10 mm inner diameter) and heated to 990 °C for 3 minutes at a heating rate of 100 °C/min under a constant load of 60 MPa, forming a fully densified block.
This block was then deformed in another graphite die (20 mm inner diameter) at 1130 °C for 5 minutes under a constant load of 40 MPa, with a heating rate of 100 °C/min.
After sintering, the samples were annealed in a muffle furnace at 1000 °C for 4 hours in air to remove any infiltrated carbon.

Prior to electrical measurements, the test surfaces of the samples were plated with heat-resistant electrodes (silver electrodes sintered at 570 °C for 30 minutes, or platinum electrodes sintered at 950 °C for 30 minutes).
Samples were poled under a DC electric field of 12–15 kV/mm at 180 °C for 15 minutes (before piezoelectric constant d33 measurement).

reference_steps: For SnS2: 4 mmol thioacetamide and 2 mmol SnCl4·5H2O were dissolved in 80 mL absolute ethanol by stirring for 30 minutes.
Mixture solution was transferred to Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160°C for 12 hours.
After naturally cooling to room temperature, SnS2 was obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60°C.
For CdS: 20 mmol Cd(NO3)2·4H2O were combined with 60 mL ethylenediamine and stirred until transparent solution formed.
60 mmol thiourea was added to solution and magnetically stirred for 30 minutes.
Mixture solution was added to Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160°C for 12 hours.
CdS was obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60°C.
For CdS@SnS2 composites: x mmol CdS precursor was dispersed in 80 mL absolute ethanol using ultrasonic agitation for 15 minutes.
Mixture of 2 mmol SnCl4·5H2O and 4 mmol thioacetamide was added to suspension and stirred at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Mixture solution was added to Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave and heated at 160°C for 12 hours.
After naturally cooling to room temperature, samples were obtained through washing, centrifugation, and drying at 60°C.

missing_keys: PZT - after 1st thermal cycle between 250 °C and room temperature
PZT - after 10th thermal cycle between 250 °C and room temperature
extra_keys: Pb[ZrxTi1-x]O3 - After 1st thermal cycle between 250 °C and room temperature
Pb[ZrxTi1-x]O3 - After 10th thermal cycle between 250 °C and room temperature

reference_steps: PZT ceramic discs (20 mm diameter, 2 mm thickness) were coated with silver using screen printing with silver paste.
Silver-coated discs were fired at approximately 800°C in air, resulting in 25 μm silver coating thickness.
Nickel wear plates (2 mm thick) were ground to achieve planarity of approximately 10 μm and roughness of about 1 μm.
Ni wear plate was coated with silver using DC sputtering process to thickness of about 6 μm.
Coated surface was heated in flowing hydrogen gas at 700°C for 2 hours to facilitate silver diffusion into nickel.
Additional silver coating of about 3 μm thickness was applied, bringing overall Ag coating to approximately 9 μm.
For diffusion bonding: components were placed in stainless-steel vessel and evacuated to less than 10^-3 Pa.
Vessel was heated to bonding temperature (275°C or 400°C) using split furnace.
Uniaxial pressure of 20 MPa was applied for 1 hour duration.
Vessel was allowed to cool to room temperature while maintaining pressure.
For PZT discs bonded at 400°C: repoling was performed by immersing in silicone oil at 150°C and applying 15 kV DC for 15 minutes.
Bonded assemblies were subjected to thermal cycles between 250°C and room temperature for stability testing.
test_steps: PZT ceramic discs (20 mm diameter, 2 ± 0.04 mm thickness) were sourced.
Both sides of PZT discs were coated with silver using screen printing with a proprietary silver paste, free of glass frit.
Screen-printed PZT discs were fired at approximately 800°C in air to achieve a final silver coating thickness of around 25 µm.
Nickel wear plates (2 mm thick) were machined from Ni-200 rods.
The surface of the Ni wear plate was ground to achieve a planarity of approximately 10 µm and a roughness of about 1 µm.
The Ni wear plate was coated with silver using a DC sputtering process to a thickness of about 6 µm.
The silver-coated Ni surface was heated in flowing hydrogen gas at 700 °C for 2 h to facilitate silver diffusion into nickel and form a solid solution.
An additional silver coating of about 3 µm thickness was applied to the Ni wear plate, bringing the overall thickness to approximately 9 µm.
For cases 1 & 2, a 1 µm thick silver coating was applied over the screen-printed silver layer on the PZT disc using DC magnetron sputtering.
For cases 3 & 4, the screen-printed silver coating on the PZT disc was removed, and a ∼ 10 µm silver was applied.
After each 3 µm layer of silver deposition, the PZT disc was heated to 800 °C to ensure adhesion of silver to the PZT disc.
The nickel wear plate and PZT disc were placed in a sample holder within a vessel.
An initial load of approximately 1 MPa was applied to the components.
The vessel was evacuated to a high vacuum of less than -E^10E^2 Pa.
The furnace was turned on, and once the desired bonding temperature (275 °C or 400 °C) was reached, a final load of 20 MPa was applied.
The components were maintained under this pressure for 1 h.
The furnace was turned off, and the vessel was allowed to cool to room temperature.
For repoling, PZT discs bonded at 400 °C were immersed in dry silicone oil maintained at 150 °C.
A DC potential of 15 kV was applied across the disc for 15 min during repoling.
After repoling, the discs were removed from the silicone oil bath and cleaned.

reference_steps: Starting materials Eu2O3, GeO2, Dy2O3, La2O3 and Ho2O3 were combined in stoichiometric ratios with each dopant at 5 mol%.
Samples were first heated at 800°C for 2 hours in pure alumina crucibles under open atmosphere.
Materials were then heated to 1150°C for 10 hours followed by slow cooling.
Resulting materials were ground into powder for further characterization.
Ceramic discs were formed from obtained powder materials with 1 mm thickness and 10 mm diameter.
Ceramic discs were compacted using uniaxial pressing under 250 MPa pressure with 2 wt% of 5 wt% PVA aqueous solution as binder.
Samples were heated at 600°C for 30 minutes to eliminate organic additives.
Sintering was conducted at 1400°C for 4 hours.
Silver paste was applied to disc surfaces and fired at 650°C for 1 hour to form surface electrodes.
Electric field of 9-18 kV/mm was applied in silicon oil bath at 120°C for 30 minutes followed by 24-hour aging.
test_steps: Combine Eu2O3, GeO2, Dy2O3, La2O3, and Ho2O3 in stoichiometric ratios, with Dy2O3, La2O3, and Ho2O3 doped at 5 mol% for nominal compositions Eu1.90Dy0.10Ge2O7, Eu1.90Ho0.10Ge2O7, Eu1.90La0.10Ge2O7.
Heat the samples at 800 °C for 2 h in pure alumina crucibles under an open atmosphere (pre-sintering).
Heat the samples to 1150 °C for 10 h in pure alumina crucibles under an open atmosphere, followed by slowly cooling (main sintering).
Form ceramic discs (1 mm thickness, 10 mm diameter) from the obtained powder materials.
Compact the ceramic discs using uniaxial pressing under 250 MPa pressure with 2 wt% of a 5 wt% PVA aqueous solution as a binder.
Heat the samples at 600 °C for 30 min to eliminate organic additives.
Conduct sintering at 1400 °C for 4 h.
Apply silver paste (99.9%) to the discs’ surfaces.
Heat and fire the discs with silver paste at 650 °C for 1 h to form surface electrodes.
Polish the discs on emery paper (1200 grit) to create smooth surfaces.

reference_steps: Raw materials BaCO3, TiO2, ZrO2, SnO2, and HfO2 were weighed according to purity and stoichiometric ratio of BaTi(1-x)(Zr1/3Sn1/3Hf1/3)xO3.
Weighed ingredients were added into alcohol and ball milled for 18 hours, then dried in oven.
Materials were calcined in muffle furnace at 1100°C for 4 hours.
Calcined materials were ball milled for 24 hours and dried again.
10 wt% polyvinyl alcohol was added to powder with uniform mixing.
Mixture was pressed into disc with diameter of 10 mm and thickness of 1 mm.
Target products were obtained by debinding process at 650°C in muffle furnace.
Final sintering process was conducted at 1350°C for 2 hours.
For piezocatalytic testing, sintered ceramics were finely ground and sieved through 100-mesh sieve.
50 mg ceramic powder was added to 50 mL dye solution and sonicated at 40 kHz, 450 W at 27-31°C for degradation testing.
test_steps: Weighed ingredients were added into alcohol, ball milled for 18 hours and dried in oven.
Materials were calcined in a muffle furnace at 1100°C for 4 hours, ball milled for 24 hours and dried again.
10 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added to the powder with uniform mixing and pressed into a disc with a diameter of 10 mm and a thickness of 1 mm.
Target products were obtained by a debinding process in a muffle furnace at 650°C and a sintering process at 1350°C for 2 hours.

reference_steps: Raw powders of (Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3, BaCO3, TiO2, and MnO2 were weighed according to chemical formula for 0.85BNT-0.15BT + x wt%MnO2.
Materials were ball-milled with zirconia balls and ethanol at 250 rpm for 16 hours.
After drying at 80°C, mixture was added with 5 wt% polyvinyl butyral binder and passed through 250 µm mesh.
Mixed powder of about 0.5 g and SrTiO3 seed crystal was pressed into disc compact at 200 MPa.
SrTiO3 seed crystal was located at center of compact with size about 3 mm×3 mm×0.5 mm.
Compacts were heated at 700°C for 2 hours in air to remove binder.
Final sintering was conducted at 1200°C for 24 hours in air with heating and cooling rates of 150°C/h.
Compacts were placed on Pt sheet on alumina plate with alumina crucible lid covering during sintering.
Grown single crystals were removed from sintered compacts by cutting and polishing.
Ag paste was applied to {110}c faces and heated to 550°C to form electrodes.
test_steps: Raw powders of (Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3, BaCO3, TiO2, and MnO2 were weighed according to the chemical formula.
The weighed powders were ball-milled with zirconia balls (1 mm diameter) and ethanol at 250 rpm for 16 h.
The mixture was dried at 80 °C.
A 5 wt% polyvinyl butyral binder was added to the dried mixture.
The mixed powder was passed through a 250 µm mesh.

About 0.5 g of the mixed powder and a SrTiO3 seed crystal (3 mm × 3 mm × 0.5 mm, with 3 mm × 3 mm faces mirror-polished and parallel to the (110) face) were pressed into a disc compact (10 mm diameter) at 200 MPa, with the SrTiO3 seed crystal located at the center.
Several compacts were heated at 700 °C for 2 h in the air to remove the binder.
The compacts were then heated at 1200 °C for 24 h in the air for sintering in a box-type electric furnace (heating and cooling rates were 150 °C/h).
Ag paste was applied to the {110}c faces of the single crystals.
The samples with Ag paste were heated to 550 °C to form Ag electrodes.

For poling, a single crystal sample was initially heated to 150 °C, a dc electric field of 30 kV/cm was applied for 15 min, followed by cooling to 50 °C with the electric field applied, and then the electric field was removed at 50 °C.

reference_steps: Raw materials BaCO3, CaCO3, TiO2, and ZrO2 were accurately weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Weighed powder and moderate ethanol were mixed and ball-milled for 12 hours.
Mixture was placed into an oven and dried at 120°C.
After powder was completely dried, it was calcined at 1250°C for 5 hours.
Calcined powder was ball-milled again for 12 hours.
Ball-milled powder was pressed into desired size and shape by cold isostatic press machine at 30 MPa for 15 minutes.
Sample was sintered at 1400-1500°C for 4 hours to obtain dense ceramic plate.
For electrical property measurement, ceramic sample was sanded and polished to 0.6 mm thickness.
Ceramic plate was coated with silver paste on both sides and calcined at 600°C for 30 minutes.
Ceramic plate was polarized by DC bias of 2-3 kV/mm for 30 minutes at room temperature.
test_steps: Raw materials (BaCO3, CaCO3, TiO2, ZrO2) were accurately weighed according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Weighed powder and moderate ethanol were mixed and ball-milled for 12 hours.
The mixture was placed into an oven and dried at 120 °C.
The completely dried powder was calcined at 1250 °C for 5 h.
The calcined powder was ball-milled again for 12 hours.
The ball-milled powder was pressed into a desired size and shape by a cold isostatic press machine at 30 MPa for 15 minutes.
The sample was kept at a sintering temperature of 1400–1500 °C for 4 hours to obtain a dense ceramic plate.
The ceramic sample was sanded and polished to obtain a smooth surface with a thickness of about 0.6 mm.
The ceramic plate was coated with silver paste on both sides.
The ceramic plate with silver paste was calcined at 600 °C for 30 minutes to fix the silver paste on the surfaces.
The ceramic plate placed in silicone was polarized by a Direct-Current (DC) bias of 2–3 kV/mm for 30 min under room temperature.

reference_steps: MgO, Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 were used to synthesize precursors MgNb2O6 at 1000°C and ScNbO4 at 1150°C.
MgNb2O6, ScNbO4, TiO2 and PbO powders were weighed according to stoichiometric proportion with 2 mol% extra PbO added.
Alcohol and oxide powders were mixed in 1:1 ratio by wet-milling for 24 hours.
Combined powder was calcined at 800-850°C for 2 hours.
Calcined mixture was mixed again for 12 hours.
Powder was conglutinated with polyvinyl alcohol solution and pressed into tablets under 8 MPa.
PVA was burned off at 550°C for 2 hours.
Ceramic tablets were covered by powders with same composition and sintered at 1200-1280°C for 4 hours.
Polished samples were coated with silver electrodes on both sides.
Samples were poled at 130°C for 15 minutes under 30 kV/cm electric field.
test_steps: Synthesize MgNb2O6 precursor at 1000 °C using MgO, Sc2O3, and Nb2O5.
Synthesize ScNbO4 precursor at 1150 °C using MgO, Sc2O3, and Nb2O5.
Weigh MgNb2O6, ScNbO4, TiO2, and PbO powders according to stoichiometric proportion, adding 2 mol% extra PbO.
Mix alcohol and the oxide powders in a 1:1 ratio by wet-milling for 24 h.
Subject the combined powder to calcination at 800–850 °C for 2 h.
Mix the calcined mixture again for 12 h.
Conglutinate the powder with a solution of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Press the conglutinated powder into tablets under 8 MPa.
Burn off the PVA at 550 °C for 2 h.
Cover the ceramic tablets with powders of the same composition to maintain a Pb-rich atmosphere.
Sinter the ceramic tablets at 1200–1280 °C for 4 h.
Polish the samples (cylindrical disks with diameters of 11.40–11.54 mm and thickness of 0.74–0.90 mm).
Coat the polished samples with silver electrodes on both sides.
Pole the samples at 130 °C for 15 min under an electric field of 30 kV/cm.

family.reference: Barium Calcium Zirconate Titanate or BCZT

test_steps: PIMNT samples were sliced into 5×5×0.5 mm³ wafers.
Silver electrodes were painted onto sample surfaces.
Electrodes were fired at 750 ℃ for 30 min.
Samples were poled with an electric field of 10 kV/cm at 140 ℃ for 15 min in silicone oil.
Samples were slowly cooled to room temperature while the electric field was halved.
Prepare a dipeptide solution in methanol (1 mg mL-1).
Drop 10 μL of the freshly prepared dipeptide solution onto the surface of a silicon substrate.
Remove the solvent using one of three methods: (1) spontaneous evaporation, (2) forced drying with warm air (45°C), or (3) spin-coating at 3000 rpm.
For saturation experiments, place a silicon substrate with a deposited dipeptide film in a Petri dish containing an organic solvent to create saturated vapor (P/P0=1).
Seal the Petri dish and keep it at room temperature for 10 minutes to 24 hours.
After saturation, dry the film with warm air (45°C).
Perform all experiments three times to ensure reproducibility and consistency of crystal growth.
Constituents were meticulously weighed according to stoichiometric ratios.
Subjected to a thorough ball-milling process for 24 h.
Milled powders were calcined at 850 °C for 3 h.
Calcined powders were granulated and pressed into disks (8.5 mm diameter, 2 mm thickness).
Green compacts were sintered within a sealed crucible at 1120 °C for 4 h.
Samples were poled under a DC field of 15 kV/mm in silicone oil at 160 °C for about 30 min.
The formulated powders were blended in ethanol for 4 h using the planetary ball milling method.
Calcination was implemented for 2 h at 850 ℃ of the dried slurries.
After secondary ball milling, the dried slurries were compressed into wafers (10 mm diameter) utilising 7 wt.% binder (polyvinyl alcohol).
The wafers were heated at 750 ℃ for 1 h to take out the polyvinyl alcohol.
Sintering at 1100 ℃ for 2 h.
Deposition of conductive buffer layer LNO on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate at 430 °C with Ar:O2 ratio of 8:1, sputtering power of 90 W, and pressure of 0.5 Pa.

Growth of PMN-PZT thin films by RF magnetron sputtering with substrate temperature maintained at 550 °C, Ar:O2 ratio of 20:1, sputtering power of 150 W, and pressure of 0.5 Pa. Different thicknesses were prepared by adjusting sputtering time.

Annealing treatment in a rapid thermal processing furnace with a heating rate of 30 °C/s between 600 °C and 700 °C for 20 mins to 40 mins in an air atmosphere to promote nucleation and crystallization.
Deposition of Au top electrodes on the top surface of the PMN-PZT thin films using DC sputtering through a shadow mask with a radius of 0.15 mm for electrical measurement.
Polarization of 1.5 µm thick PMN-PZT thin film for piezoelectric coefficient measurement: 10 kV/mm at 140 °C for 5 mins, with upward and downward DC electric fields applied.
Weigh precise amounts of Sc2O3, TiO2, ZnO, Bi2O3, and Pb3O4 according to the stoichiometric ratio with an excess of 1 mol% for both Bi2O3 and Pb3O4.
Subject the resulting powders to ball milling in alcohol for 12 h.
Dry the milled powders.
Calcine the powders at 750 °C for 4 h to obtain pure BZT-BS-PT ceramic powders.
Perform two rounds of milling and drying.
Carry out a granulation process by adding 5 wt% PVA to the powder mixture.
Press the ceramic green body under a uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Heat treat the pressed body at 600 °C for 4 h to remove any remaining adhesive material.
Employ a buried firing process by subjecting the ceramic body to a temperature of 1000 °C for 3 h to achieve fully densified BZT-BS-PT ceramics.
Etch the cross-section of the ceramic in a mixed solution of hydrofluoric acid and hydrochloric acid.
Sputter a gold electrode on the ceramic surface with a high vacuum sputtering coater.
Polarize the ceramics in silicone oil with a direct-current field of 4 kV/mm and a temperature of 180 °C for 5 min.

method.test: Solid phase reaction, Vat photopolymerization additive manufacturing

reference_steps: Raw materials were mixed with alcohol and ball milled for 24 hours.
Calcined powder was obtained by heating at 1300°C for 3 hours.
BCZT powders were produced by a second stage of ball milling for varying time periods (1-12 hours).
BCZT ceramic slurry was prepared by mixing ceramic powder with light-sensitive oligomers, diluent, photo-initiator and dispersant using vacuum mixer for 300 s at 2500 rpm.
Ceramic slurry was poured into VPP printer to produce ceramic green body with 30 μm layer thickness.
Debinding of ceramic green body was completed in tube furnace at 425°C for 4 hours with temperature ramp rates of 0.1-0.3°C/min in argon atmosphere.
Sample was kept at 550°C for 2 hours to remove residual carbon during sintering process.
BCZT ceramic scaffold was obtained by heating at 3°C/min to sintering temperature (1380-1440°C) and furnace cooling after holding for 3 hours.
Sintered BCZT ceramics were polarized at 15 kV for 1 hour using corona poling technique.
ITO film was glued to both sides of BCZT scaffold with silver glue and cured for 12 hours at room temperature.
test_steps: BCZT powder was synthesized by solid phase reaction method.
Raw materials (BaCO3, CaCO3, TiO2, ZrO2) were mixed with alcohol and ball milled for 24 hours.
The calcined powder was obtained by heating at 1300 ℃ for 3 hours.
BCZT powders for vat photopolymerization were produced by a second stage of ball milling using a range of time periods (1 h, 2 h, 4 h, 12 h).
The photosensitive resin was composed of polyurethane acrylate, 1,6-hexanediol diacrylate (HDDA), ethoxylated (5) pentaerythritol tetra acrylate (PPTTA).
Bis(2,4,6-trimethylbenzoyl)phenylphosphine oxide (Omnirad 380) was selected as the photo-initiator.
Solsperse 41000 was used as the dispersant.

The BCZT ceramic slurry was prepared by mixing the ceramic powder with light-sensitive oligomers, a diluent, photo-initiator and dispersant (0.5 wt% of the ceramic powder) using a vacuum mixer for 300 s at 2500 rpm.
The ceramic slurry was then poured into the VPP printer to produce the ceramic green body; the layer thickness was set to 30 μm.
Debinding of the resulting ceramic green body was completed in a tube furnace at 425 ℃ for 4 h, with varying temperature ramp rates of 0.1 ℃ min⁻¹, 0.2 ℃ min⁻¹ and 0.3 ℃ min⁻¹.
During the sintering process, the sample was kept at 550 ℃ for 2 h to remove any residual carbon.
The BCZT ceramic scaffold structure was obtained by heating at 3 ℃ min⁻¹ to the sintering temperature (1380 ℃, 1400 ℃, 1420 ℃, 1440 ℃) and furnace cooling to room temperature after holding for 3 h.
The sintered BCZT ceramics were directly polarized at 15 kV for 1 h using a corona poling technique.
A polyethylene glycol terephthalate (PET) film, covered with indium tin oxide (ITO), was glued to both sides of the BCZT scaffold with a silver glue.
The resulting piezoelectric sensor was obtained after curing for 12 h at room temperature.

reference_steps: High purity chemical powders were weighed stoichiometrically and ball milled for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media.
Mixed powders were dried in an oven, followed by calcination at 900°C for 3 hours.
Disc-shaped pellets were prepared using ~13 mm diameter under uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Sintering was carried out at 1150-1200°C for 2-4 hours.
For XRD measurements, sintered pellets were grounded and annealed at 500°C for 1 hour to remove any strain.
For electrical property measurement, samples were thinned to ~1 mm and electroded on both sides using silver paste.
Samples were annealed at 500°C for 1 hour after electrode application.
Electrical poling was done by applying DC field of 4-5 kV/mm for 15-30 min in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Weighed precursors stoichiometrically
Ball milled for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media
Dried mixed powders in an oven
Calcined at 900°C for 3 hours
Prepared disc-shaped pellets using ~13 mm diameter under a uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa
Sintered at 1150–1200°C for 2–4 hours
For X-ray diffraction measurements, sintered pellets were grounded and annealed at 500 °C for 1 hour to remove any strain
For electrical property measurement, samples were thinned to ~1 mm
Electroded samples on both sides using silver paste and annealed at 500 °C for 1 hour
Electrical poling was done by applying a DC field of 4–5 kV/mm for 15–30 min in a silicone oil bath

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio of (1-x)(0.7BiFeO3-0.3BaTiO3)-x(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-5 mol% Bi2O3 with x = 0.000, 0.001, 0.002, 0.003.
Materials were processed using traditional solid-state reaction method.
Ceramics were sintered to obtain final products.
Samples were poled for 24 hours at room temperature before electrical measurements.
test_steps: A series of (1-x)(0.7BiFeO3-0.3BaTiO3)- x(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-5 mol% Bi2O3 (x = 0.000, 0.001, 0.002, 0.003) ceramics were prepared.

reference_steps: LNO precursor prepared by dissolving equimolar La(NO3)3 and Ni(NO3)2 in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
TiO precursor prepared by dissolving Ti-n-butoxide in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
PZT precursor prepared by dissolving Pb(CH3COO)2 in glacial acetic acid, adding Zr(OC4H9)4 and Ti(OC4H9)4 stoichiometrically with distilled water and ethylene glycol.
10 wt% polyvinyl pyrrolidone added to PZT precursor and stirred for 1 hr, then filtered.
Buffer layers deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate.
Buffer layers annealed at 650°C for 30 mins.
PZT film deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Two-step annealing process: 400°C for 2 mins, then 650°C for 2 mins.
Process repeated for 12 cycles to achieve ~1000 nm thickness.
Final annealing at 650°C for 30 mins in open-air atmosphere.
Pt top electrode deposited by DC sputtering for electrical measurements.
test_steps: 0.1 M concentration of LNO precursor solution is prepared by dissolving equimolar quantity of Lanthanum (III) nitrate and Nickel (II) nitrate salts incorporated into glacial acetic acid and 0.01 M concentration of ethylene glycol is added and stirred for 1 hr.

0.3 M concentration of TiO precursor solution is prepared by dissolving Ti-n butoxide in glacial acetic acid and stirred for 1 hr, then 0.01 M concentration of ethylene glycol is added and stirred for 1 hr.

0.1 M concentration of PZT precursor solution is prepared by dissolving Lead (II) acetate salt in glacial acetic acid and stoichiometric concentration of Zirconium (IV) n-butoxide and Titanium (IV) n-butoxide is separately added with the lead precursor and stirred.
Appropriate amount of distilled water and ethylene glycol are added to the PZT precursor solution and stirred for 30 mins.
10 wt% of polyvinyl pyrrolidone is added to the PZT precursor solution and stirred for another 1 hr.
The PZT precursor solution is filtered using Whatman filter paper prior to deposition.
Buffer interface layers (TiO, LNO, LNO/TiO) are prepared by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Buffer layers are subsequently annealed at 650 °C for 30 mins.
PZT film is deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
PZT film undergoes a two-step annealing process: 400 °C for 2 mins and 650 °C for 2 mins.
All films undergo 12 cycles to achieve a desired thickness of ~1000 nm.
All films are subsequently annealed at 650 °C for 30 mins in an open-air atmosphere furnace.
Pt top electrode (thickness 100 nm) is deposited by DC sputtering.

reference_steps: 1.0 mol% Mn-doped 0.28Pb(In1/2Nb1/2)O3-0.42Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.30PbTiO3 single crystal grown along [001] by modified Bridgman method.
Single crystal cut into 6 × 6 × 0.38 mm³ unit sheets from same horizontal cross-section.
Unit sheets annealed at 600°C for 4 hours and cleaned.
Ultrathin conductive gold layers with 100 nm thickness deposited by sputtering method.
0.5 mm wide insulating margins left on alternating surfaces during electrode plating.
Direct current polarization along [001] direction at 135°C, 1 kV/mm for 10 minutes using CS2674 AX voltage tester in thermostatic oil bath.
15 layers of unit sheets bonded using E-44(6101) epoxy in electrical parallel and mechanical series configuration.
Zirconia ceramic sheets (0.5 mm thickness) affixed to top and bottom surfaces for rigidity.
Stacked samples subjected to 5 MPa pressure longitudinally using isostatic press.
Static curing for 48 hours to obtain final PSAs with dimensions 6 × 6 × 6.7 mm³.
test_steps: Growth of 1.0 mol% Mn-doped 0.28Pb(In1/2Nb1/2)O3-0.42Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.30PbTiO3 single crystal along [001] by the modified Bridgman method.
Cutting the single crystal into 6 × 6 × 0.38 mm³ unit sheets.
Extracting unit sheets from the same horizontal cross-section of the single crystal boule.
Annealing unit sheets at 600 ℃ for 4 hours.
Cleaning unit sheets.
Depositing ultrathin conductive gold layers with a thickness of 100 nm on the surface of unit sheets by a sputtering method.
Creating an electrically parallel structure by leaving 0.5 mm wide insulating margins on alternating upper and lower surfaces during the electrode plating process.
Direct current polarization (DCP) of unit sheets along the [001] direction, with a condition of 135 ℃, 1 kV/mm, and 10 minutes.
Bonding 15 layers of unit sheets using E-44(6101) epoxy in an electrical parallel and mechanical series configuration.
Affixing zirconia ceramic sheets with a thickness of 0.5 mm to the top and bottom surfaces of the stacked samples.
Subjecting the stacked samples to a 5 MPa pressure applied longitudinally using an isostatic press.
Statically curing for 48 hours.
Finishing PSAs with dimensions of 6 × 6 × 6.7 mm³.
Connecting wires to PSAs.
