reference_steps: Stoichiometric raw materials weighed for (0.994-x)(K0.48Na0.52)(Nb0.97Sb0.03)O3-0.006BiFeO3-xBi0.5Na0.5ZrO3 with x=0-0.12 mol%.
Raw materials ball-milled in alcohol for 24 hours to reduce particle size.
Mixed powder dried in hot air oven at 100°C for 24 h to remove residual alcohol.
Dried powder sieved to ensure uniform particle size and calcined at 900°C for 6 h.
Fine powder pressed into pellets using uniaxial pressing at 100-200 MPa pressure.
Pellets sintered at 1120-1140°C for 3 h.
Sintered pellets divided into two portions: one polished and ground into fine particles for composite film fabrication.
Other portion polished and painted with silver paste electrodes for electrical property testing.
For composite films: KNNS-BF-3BNZ ceramic powder dispersed in ethyl alcohol using sonication for 3 h.
Dispersed powder mixed with PDMS in various proportions (0-30 wt%) and combined with curing agent (10:1 ratio).
Mixture loaded into syringe and poured into prepared mold, placed at room temperature for 48 hours.
Dried KNNS-BF-3BNZ/PDMS film cut into 3×3 cm sheets with 3 mm thickness.
test_steps: Stoichiometric raw materials (K2CO3, Na2CO3, Nb2O5, Sb2O3, Bi2O3, Fe2O3, ZrO2) were weighed.
Ball-milled the weighed raw materials in alcohol for 24 hours to reduce particle size.
Dried the mixed powder in a hot air oven at around 100°C for 24 hours to remove residual alcohol.
Sieved the dried powder to ensure uniform particle size.
Calcined the powder at 900°C for 6 hours.
Pressed the fine powder into pellets using uniaxial pressing with a pressure of about 100–200 MPa to form dense pellets.
Sintered the pellets at 1120–1140°C for 3 hours to synthesize KNNS-BF-xBNZ ceramic.
For composite films, KNNS-BF-xBNZ ceramic powder (specifically x=0.03 mol% for KNNS-BF-3BNZ) was dispersed in ethyl alcohol (99.8 %) using sonication for 3 hours to break up agglomerates.
The dispersed powder was mixed with PDMS in various proportions (0 to 30 wt%).
Combined the mixture with a curing agent (PDMS to curing agent ratio of 10:1).
Loaded the mixture into a syringe to pour a thin layer into a prepared mold.
Placed the mold at room temperature for 48 hours.
Cut the dried KNNS-BF-xBNZ/PDMS film into sheets of 3x3 cm with a thickness of 3 mm.
To prepare the PENG device, the KNNS-BF-3BNZ/PDMS composite film was sandwiched between aluminum foil sheets on both the top and bottom surfaces to serve as electrodes.

reference_steps: Powders of PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Ta2O5 weighed according to [Pb0.09Sm0.01][(Zr0.54Ti0.46)1-xTax]O3 stoichiometry with x = 0, 0.01, 0.02, and 0.03.
Weighed powders subjected to wet-ball milling for 8 h.
Milled powders calcined at 850°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder sintered between 1150-1200°C for 2 h.
Ceramics coated with silver electrodes.
Poling performed in silicone oil at 150°C under 3 kV/mm electric field for 0.5 h.
Raw materials Bi2O3, Fe2O3, BaCO3, TiO2 weighed for 0.69BiFeO3-0.31BaTiO3 composition.
Separate preparation of (0.8BNT-0.2BKT) using same solid-state method.
Weighed powders ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h.
Powder mixture dried at 100°C for 12 h.
Powder calcined in air at 760°C for 6 h at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) added to powder as binder.
Powder pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form discs with 8 mm diameter.
Samples sintered at 600°C for 3 h to remove PVA binder.
Final sintering at 970°C for 6 h.
Silver paste applied to surfaces and fired at 450°C for 30 min.
Silver-plated ceramic samples polarized in silicone oil at 110°C for 15 min using DC field of 5 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weighed powder was ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h.
Dried at 100 ℃ for 12 h.
Powder mixture was calcined in air at 760 ℃ for 6 h at a rate of 2 ℃ per minute (This method was also used for 0.8BNT-0.2BKT preparation).
8 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added to the powder as a binder.
Pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form discs with a diameter of 8 mm.
Sintered at 600 ℃ for 3 h to remove PVA.
Sintered at 970 ℃ for 6 h.
Silver paste was applied to the surfaces and fired at 450 ℃ for 30 min.
Silver-plated ceramic samples were polarised in silicone oil at 110 ℃ for 15 min using a DC field of 5 kV/cm.

reference_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, TiO2, Fe2O3, and Yb2O3 weighed in stoichiometric ratios for Bi5-xYbxTi3FeO15 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06, 0.08, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Raw materials mixed and milled with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 h.
After drying, mixture calcined at 750°C for 3 h to synthesize target product.
Calcined mixture ground, milled, and dried again under same conditions.
Resulting powder granulated with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binders.
Powder pressed into disks 12 mm in diameter and 1.0 mm in thickness.
Each disk heated at 650°C to burn off PVA binder.
Final sintering at 1050-1060°C for 3 h at heating rate of 3°C/min in aluminum oxide crucible.
For electrical measurements, silver electrodes screen-printed on both surfaces of polished samples.
Silver electrodes fired at 570°C for 20 min.
Samples poled in silicone oil under DC electric field of 60-70 kV/cm at 150°C for 20 min.
High purity ZnO and Nb2O5 used to synthesize ZnNb2O6 precursor at 1000°C.
ZnNb2O6 precursor mixed with high purity Pb3O4, HfO2, and TiO2 for Pb(Zn1/3Nb2/3)x(Hf0.49Ti0.51)1-xO3 compositions with 0.05≤x≤0.20.
Mixture ball milled to ensure homogeneity.
Ball-milled powder calcined at 850°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder pressed into pellets.
Pellets sintered at 1050°C for 2 h to form corresponding ceramics.
For electrical measurements, silver electrodes applied to upper and lower surfaces.
Ceramics with silver electrodes placed in silicone oil at 120°C.
Poling performed under electric field of 4 kV/mm for 30 min.
High-purity raw materials Bi2O3, WO3, Nb2O5, and TiO2 weighed for Bi3Ti(1.5-x)NbxW0.5O9 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.01, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06.
Raw materials ball milled and crushed with zirconia balls using anhydrous ethanol as medium.
Mass ratio of raw material:ball mill media:anhydrous ethanol was 1:2:1.5.
Ball milling conducted for 24 h.
Samples pre-sintered at 800°C with holding time of 2 h.
Powder pelletized with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Material aged for 24 hours, then subjected to pressure of 16 MPa.
Debinding process performed to remove PVA.
Final sintering conducted in muffle furnace at temperatures between 1010-1030°C.
For electrical measurements, samples coated with silver on both sides to form electrodes.
Samples placed in silicone oil at 160°C and subjected to DC field of 11-18 kV/mm for 30 min for poling.
test_steps: Bi3Ti(1.5-x)Nb x W0.5O9 (x = 0.00, 0.01, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06, BTW-xNb) ceramics were prepared.

The BTW-xNb ceramic samples were prepared by ball milling and crushing with zirconia balls and anhydrous ethanol as the media, with a mass ratio of the raw material, ball mill sub and anhydrous ethanol of 1:2:1.5, and a ball milling time of 24 h.
The samples were pre-sintered at 800 °C with a holding time of 2 h.
The pre-sintered material was pelletised with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Following a 24-hour ageing period, the material was subjected to a pressure of 16 MPa and subsequently debonded.
The material was then placed in a muffle furnace at temperatures between 1010 and 1030°C for sintering.
The samples were coated with silver on both sides to form electrodes.
The samples were placed in silicone oil at 160 °C and subjected to a DC field of 11–18 kV/mm for 30 min.

method.reference: molten salt method and templated grain growth (TGG)

reference_steps: [001]-oriented BTO template powders synthesized from Bi2O3 and TiO2 using molten salt method with equal molar ratio of NaCl and KCl in 1:1 wt ratio.
Template powder sintered at 1100°C for 1 h.
BTO matrix powders prepared by solid-state reaction with Bi2O3 and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Raw materials calcined at 700°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder ball milled for 48-72 h to achieve small particle size.
Template and matrix powders mixed by ball milling at ~60 rpm using xylene and ethanol as solvents.
5 vol% BTO template added to solution and stirred for 1 h to ensure homogenization.
Tape casting performed with blade gap of 210 μm.
After drying at room temperature for 8-10 h, tapes cut into 10 × 10 mm squares.
Squares laminated under pressure of 75 MPa for 1-3 h.
Organics burned off at 600°C for 3 h.
Green bodies heated in tube furnace from 650°C to 1000°C at rate of 10°C/min for texture evolution assessment.
Green bodies sintered in oxygen atmosphere at 950°C for 0-6 h for electrical property measurements.
Raw materials CaCO3, Na2CO3, Pr6O11, CeO2, Bi2O3, and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric composition for Ca1−x(Na0.5Pr0.25Ce0.25)xBi4Ti4O15 with x = 0, 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h with anhydrous ethanol as solvent.
Ball-milling mixture dried at 70°C for 6 h.
Dried powders calcined for 4 h at 850°C.
0.2 wt% MnO2 added to calcined powders.
Calcined powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h and dried again.
6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder added to calcined powders.
Powders pressed into discs under pressure of 6-8 MPa.
Discs heated at 600°C for 2 h to remove PVA.
Pellets sintered at 950-1050°C for 2.5 h in air.
During sintering, discs covered by their powders in sealed alumina crucibles to reduce volatility of Bi and Na.
For electrical measurements, samples poled in silicone oil bath at 180°C under DC electric field of 14-16 kV/mm for 30 min.
test_steps: Grinding of CaCO3, Na2CO3, Pr6O11, CeO2, Bi2O3, and TiO2 powders using a planetary ball mill for 12 h with anhydrous ethanol as solvent.
Drying of the ball-milling mixture at 70 °C for 6 h.
Calcination of the dried powders for 4 h at 850 °C.
Addition of 0.2 wt% MnO2 to the calcined powders.
Grinding of the calcined powders with MnO2 using a planetary ball mill for 12 h.
Drying of the ground powders again.
Addition of 6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder (PVA) to the calcined powders.
Pressing the powders into discs under a pressure of 6–8 MPa.
Heating the discs at 600 °C for 2 h to remove the PVA.
Sintering the pellets at 950 °C-1050 °C for 2.5 h in the air.

reference_steps: Raw materials Pb3O4, SrCO3, MgO, Nb2O5, TiO2, and ZrO2 mixed according to stoichiometric ratio and accurately weighed.
Materials ball milled for 18 h.
Dried powder calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
MnCO3 added to calcined powder with Mn content x ranging from 0 to 0.8 in 0.2 increments.
Ball milled for 18 h after MnCO3 addition.
Polyvinyl butyral used as binder to press dried powder into disks with 10 mm diameter.
Organics removed at 600°C for 3 h.
Green discs sintered at 1150-1250°C for 3 h.
For electrical measurements, both sides of sintered samples coated with silver electrodes and held at 550°C for 30 min.
Ceramics polarized in 150°C silicone oil with DC electric field of 3 kV/mm for 35 min.

Precursors bismuth(III) nitrate pentahydrate, sodium acetate, potassium acetate, titanium(IV) butoxide, and manganese(II) acetate mixed in stoichiometric ratios for 3 mol% Mn-doped 0.8(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3–0.2(Bi0.5K0.5)TiO3.
Propan-2-ol and acetic acid used as solvents, with pentane-2,4-dione as polymerizing agent.
Mixture stirred at room temperature at 700 rpm.
Formamide added last for drying control.
Final 0.3 M solution allowed to polymerize for seven days before deposition.
6 layers of BNKT-20-3M deposited on commercial Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating.
Each layer spin-coated at 500 rpm for 10 s, then at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Heat treatments applied after each layer: evaporation at 200°C, pyrolysis at 500°C, and annealing at 750°C, each for 5 min.
After annealing, layer subjected to either fast quenching in liquid nitrogen (LNQ) or air-cooling (AC) to room temperature.
Process repeated 6 times to obtain thin-film sample approximately 220 nm thick.
Some samples further heat-treated in nitrogen atmosphere at 1 atm, 750°C for 30 min for defect passivation.
Circular Pt top electrodes with area of 0.283 mm² deposited by RF magnetron sputtering to create metal-insulator-metal structure.
test_steps: Mix bismuth(III) nitrate pentahydrate, sodium acetate, potassium acetate, titanium(IV) butoxide, and manganese(II) acetate in their respective stoichiometric ratios.
Use propan-2-ol and acetic acid as solvents, and pentane-2,4-dione as the polymerizing agent.
Stir the mixture at room temperature at 700 rpm with formamide.
Allow the final 0.3 M solution to polymerize for seven days.
Deposit 6 layers of BNKT-20-3M solution on commercial Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating.
For each layer, spin at 500 rpm for 10 s and then at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Apply a series of heat treatments after spin-coating: evaporation at 200 °C, pyrolysis at 500 °C, and annealing at 750 °C, each for 5 min.
Repeat the above-described sequence 6 times, resulting in a thin-film sample approximately 220 nm thick.
Some thin-film samples were further heat-treated in a nitrogen (N2) atmosphere at 1 atm, 750 °C for 30 min after the cooling procedure for defect passivation.
Deposit circular Pt top electrodes with an area of 0.283 mm² on the thin-film sample by RF magnetron sputtering in argon plasma.
Synthesized 0.15PSN-0.57PMN-0.28PT matrix powder (average 300 nm particle size) using traditional solid state reaction method.
Produced pure perovskite matrix powder by sintering the mixed raw materials at 750 °C for 2 h.
Synthesized plate-like BT templates with [001] orientation by the topochemical transformation technique.
Sliced, stacked, and compressed embryo strips for 30 min at 70 °C with 10 MPa of pressure.
Discharged organic matters by sintering at 550 °C for 2 h.
Subjected samples to isostatic pressing at a pressure of 200 MPa for 1 min.
Sintered the sample in an air atmosphere at 1200–1270 °C for 0–11 h.
0.5Pb(Ni1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.16PbZrO3-0.34PbTiO3 matrix powders were synthesized by conventional solid-state reaction with the raw materials PbO, NiO, Nb2O5, ZrO2, and TiO2.
The mixture of raw materials was ball-milled using zirconia balls (Φ = 1 mm, 3 mm, 5 mm, and 10 mm) for 24 h and dried at 90°C.
The milled PNN-PZT powders were calcined at 850°C for 4 h (heating rate: 5°C/min).
0.2 wt% of Li2CO3 was added to the calcined 0.5Pb(Ni1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.16PbZrO3-0.34PbTiO3 powder as a sintering aid.
The mixture was subsequently ball-milled for 48 h with zirconia balls (Φ = 1 mm, 3 mm, 5 mm, and 10 mm) and dried at 90°C.

Ethyl alcohol, toluene, dibutyl phthalate, polyvinyl butyral, and dispersant were mixed with PNNZT powders at an optimized ratio and ball-milled for 24 h with zirconia balls (Φ = 3 mm, 5 mm, 10 mm, and 15 mm).
After ball milling, the PNNZT slurry was separated from the zirconia balls using a mesh fabric, and any remaining air bubbles were removed using a vacuum chamber for 15 min.
An aging process followed for 2 h at 15 rpm to stabilize the slurry.
BT-template-free thick sheets were prepared via tape casting at a casting speed of 1 m/min with a blade gap of 85 μm.

Ethyl alcohol, toluene, dibutyl phthalate, polyvinyl butyral, and dispersant were mixed with PNNZT powders at an optimized ratio and ball-milled for 24 h with zirconia balls (Φ = 3 mm, 5 mm, 10 mm, and 15 mm).
After ball milling, the PNNZT slurry was separated from the zirconia balls using a mesh fabric.
BT templates were dispersed in a small amount of ethanol using a sonicator for 5 min and then added to the separated PNNZT slurry.
Any remaining air bubbles in the slurry were removed using a vacuum chamber for 15 min.
The slurry was then aged for 2 h at 15 rpm to stabilize it.
BT-included thin sheets were prepared via tape casting at a casting speed of 1 m/min with a blade gap of 8 μm.
The obtained PNNZT and PNNZT-BT sheets were alternately laminated, one by one, using a lamination machine under 10 MPa of pressure and at a temperature of 60°C.
The laminated sheets were then subjected to a warm isostatic pressing (WIP) process by applying 25 MPa of pressure at 65°C for 20 min.
After the WIP process, the PNNZT/PNNZT-BT laminates were cut into 10 mm × 10 mm pieces using a blade cutter.
To burn out the organic components, the cut pieces were fired at 300°C and 600°C for 5 h at each temperature, with a heating rate of 1°C/min.
The fired PNNZT/PNNZT-BT laminates were pressed using a cold isostatic press (CIP) machine for 1 min under 200 MPa at room temperature.
The CIP-treated specimens were then sintered at various temperatures ranging from 900°C to 1025°C, in 25°C intervals, for 15 h under an O2 atmosphere (flow rate: 1 L/min, heating rate: 1°C/min).
After sintering, Ag paste was applied to both sides of the sintered body and fired at 700°C for 10 min.
Poling was conducted at 3.5 kV/mm for 20 min at room temperature in silicone oil.

test: High temperature in-situ d33 test instrument
extra_items: High temperature in-situ d33 test instrument

test_steps: Weighed raw materials (Bi2O3, Fe2O3, BaCO3, TiO2) according to stoichiometric formula.
Added excess 2 mol% Bi2O3 powders for compensation.
Planetary milled powders using ethanol as a dispersant with zirconia balls for 12 h.
Dried mixed oxides.
Calcined at 800 °C for 6 h.
Re-milled calcined powders with ethanol and zirconia ball for 12 h.
Dried re-milled powders.
Mixed with 7 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Pressed into 10 mm diameter pellets.
Burned out PVA at 300 °C for 1 h.
Sintered at 970 °C for 3 h.
Polished samples to 0.5 mm thickness.
Pasted samples with high-temperature silver electrodes.
Fired electrodes at 850 °C for 30 min.
Performed DC poling with 4 kV/mm electric field at 80 °C in a silicone oil bath for 20 min.
Aged samples for 24 h before electrical characterizations.
Raw materials prepared according to calculated ratios
Planetary ball mill for 4 hours
Slurry dried at 100 ℃
Calcined at 850 ℃ for 2 hours
7 wt.% of binder (polyvinyl alcohol) added to dried slurry
Powder well grounded
Powder pressed into 10 mm diameter discs
Calcined at 1100 ℃ for 2 hours

test: Programmable furnace with precision impedance analyzer
extra_items: Programmable furnace with precision impedance analyzer

test_steps: Raw materials powders were first placed in an oven and heated to 120 °C for 6 h.
Raw materials were weighed in accordance with the nominal stoichiometric ratio and mixed into a ball-milled tank filled with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia ball medium (HDPE material).
The mixture was mixed on a horizontal rolling ball mill at a rotating speed of 410 r/min for 24 h and then dried.
The obtained mixture was sieved by a 100-mesh sifter.
Calcined at 750 °C for 6 h.
The calcined powders were subjected to secondary ball milling for 24 h.
Sieved through a 150-mesh sifter after dried.
The synthesized powders were then compacted to disks of 25 mm in diameter and 2–3 mm in thickness.
Normal sintering in air at 1108 °C for 21 h in a muffle furnace.
As-grown crystals were cut out from the ceramic matrix and ground into disc-like specimens with a thickness of 0.5–0.6 mm.
The sintered samples were poled under a DC field of 30 kV/cm at 100°C for 30 min in a silicone oil bath.
Precursor powders were prepared according to stoichiometric ratios.
Components were thoroughly mixed in ethanol via ball milling for 15 h.
After drying, the mixture was placed into a covered alumina crucible and calcined at 810 °C for 5 h to produce the precursor powders.
The mixture was heated to 1200 °C and slowly cooled to 850 °C to promote single crystal growth.
Cut crystal wafers were coated with silver paste and sintered at 850 °C for 30 min.
Poling was achieved by immersing the single crystals in silicone oil and applying a DC electric field of 40 kV/cm for 10 min at room temperature.
Raw materials (Bi2O3, Fe2O3, BaCO3, TiO2, and La2O3) were weighed according to stoichiometric ratios.
Mixed well in absolute ethyl alcohol for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
The slurry was dried in an oven at 95 °C.
Calcined at 800 °C for 4 h.
Add 5 wt % PVA to the dry powder.
Use 18 Mpa pressure to press into wafers with 1 mm in thickness and 12 mm in diameter.
PVA was removed at 600 °C for 120 min.
Sintered at 990 °C–1000 °C for 3h.
Polished with 800 mesh sandpaper.
Silver paste was used to prepare samples at 600 °C for 20 min.
Ceramic samples with electrodes were polarized for 30 min under a direct current electric field of 4–5 kV/mm at 85 °C.
Quenching procedure: anneal the BLF-0.3BT, BLF-0.31BT, and BLF-0.32BT sample at 970 °C for 30 min and then quench in air.
6 mmol P25, 4-x mmol Bi2O3, x mmol La2O3, NaCl and KCl reagents were mixed and ground (NaCl: KCl: Bi4-x La x Ti3O12 = 50: 50: 1; x = 0, 0.25, 0.75, 1.0, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75)
calcined at 800 °C for 2h in a muffle furnace
washed several times with deionized water
dried in air at 80 °C

reference_steps: Yb2O3, MgO and Nb2O5 were used to synthesize fine YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors.
Stoichiometric PbO, TiO2, MnO2, YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors were ball-milled in ethanol with ZrO2 media.
The mixture was calcined at 775°C for 2h followed by ball milling again.
BaTiO3 platelets prepared by topochemical microcrystal conversion were used as templates.
Organic binders and solvents were mixed with the fine matrix and ball-milled.
3 vol% BT templates were added into the slurry.
The slurry was di-aired and tape-casted by a doctor blade.
The dried tapes were cut, stacked and laminated into blocks.
After binders burning out, green samples were cold isostatic pressed at 200 MPa.
Textured ceramics were sintered between 1150 and 1200°C for 6h.
To avoid lead volatilization, samples were embedded in coarse matrix powders with same compositions during sintering process.
test_steps: Synthesis of YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors from Yb2O3, MgO, and Nb2O5.
Ball-milling of stoichiometric PbO, TiO2, MnO2, YbNbO4, and MgNb2O6 precursors in ethanol with ZrO2 media.
Calcination at 775 °C for 2h.
Second ball milling.
Addition of 3 vol% BaTiO3 templates into the slurry (for textured ceramics only).
Binders burning out.
Cold isostatic pressing at 200 MPa.
Sintering between 1150 and 1200 °C for 6h.

reference_steps: High purity raw materials were weighed based on stoichiometric formula for BNT-6BT ceramics.
Weighed raw materials were ball-milled for 24 h in ethanol using zirconia balls with 3 mm diameter.
Dried powders were calcined at 900°C for 4 hours.
1 mol% B3+ was added to pre-synthesized undoped and 1 mol% Mn3+ doped BNT-6BT before second milling.
Screened powders (<90 μm) were mixed with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Mixture was uniaxially pressed at 100 MPa pressure to form disc samples with 12 mm diameter.
Pre-shaped specimens were re-pressed via cold isostatic press at 150 MPa.
PVA binder was burnt out at 600°C for 4 h with 1°C/min heating rate.
Final sintering process was performed at 1150°C for 12 h in air.
test_steps: Weighed raw materials.
Ball-milled raw materials for 24 h in ethanol using zirconia balls with 3 mm of diameter.
Dried and calcined powders at 900 °C for 4 h.
Added 1 mol% BE³⁺ to both pre-synthesized undoped and 1 mol% MnE³⁺ doped BNT-6BT before the second milling process.
Shaped disc samples by uniaxially pressing at 100 MPa pressure with a diameter of 12 mm using screened powders (<90 µm) mixed with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder.
Re-pressed pre-shaped specimens via a cold isostatic press (CIP) at 150 MPa.
Burnt out PVA binder at 600 °C for 4 h in the furnace set to a 1 °C/min heating rate.
Performed sintering process at 1150 °C for 12 h in air.
Polished and gold electroded samples.
Poled samples for 5, 10, 15, and 20 min at room temperature (RT), 40, 60, and 80 °C, and under an electric field between 3 and 5 kV/mm in silicone oil bath.

reference_steps: Pure Mg substrate was mechanically ground with SiC paper up to 1000 grit and ultrasonically cleaned in ethyl alcohol.
Electrolyte was prepared with 20 g/L Na2SiO3 + 4 g/L KF + 2 g/L NaOH.
BaTiO3 powder (2 g/L or 5 g/L) was added to the electrolyte.
Mg plates were used as anode and stainless steel chamber as cathode during PEO process.
Pulse reverse power provided constant current of 2 A/dm2 for 660 s under frequency of 500 Hz and duty cycle of 15%.
Solution was cooled using water-cooling system at 30 ± 5°C during coating process.
After PEO treatment samples were rinsed in distilled water and dried in warm air.
test_steps: Pure Mg samples (30 mm × 15 mm × 2 mm) were mechanically ground with SiC paper up to 1000 grit.
Samples were ultrasonically cleaned in ethyl alcohol.
Samples were dried in cold air.
During the PEO process, Mg plates were used as the anode, and a stainless steel chamber was used as the cathode and reactor.
A pulse reverse power provided a constant current of 2 A/dm² for 660 s under a frequency of 500 Hz and a duty cycle of 15 %.
The electrolyte was prepared based on silicate salt (20 g/L Na2SiO3 + 4 g/L KF + 2 g/L NaOH).
BaTiO3 powder (globular, 100–200 nm) was added to the electrolyte at concentrations of 2 g/L (for PEO-BTO2) and 5 g/L (for PEO-BTO5).
The solution was cooled down using a water-cooling system at 30 ± 5 °C during the coating process.
After PEO treatment, the samples were rinsed in distilled water.
Samples were dried in warm air.

reference_steps: NBT-0.6CeO2 powders (0.05-0.25 vol%) were dispersed in P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using 10 wt% DEC solvent.
Thin films were fabricated by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes.
Metal-insulator-metal structure was formed by depositing additional aluminum electrodes onto spin-coated films.
Samples were annealed at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
For piezoelectric measurements, bulk samples were prepared by solution casting method with thickness of 30 μm.
Samples underwent DC poling at 65°C under electric field of 200 MV/m for 60 min in silicone oil bath.
Samples were slowly cooled to room temperature while maintaining electric field.
test_steps: NBT-0.6CeO2 (0.05–0.25 vol%) was dispersed in a P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using 10 wt% DEC solvent to prepare the composite.
Thin films (0.8–1 µm thickness, depending on filler concentration) were fabricated by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes.
A metal-insulator-metal (MIM) structure was formed by depositing additional aluminum electrodes onto the spin-coated films.
Samples were annealed at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
Bulk samples (thickness of 30 µm) were prepared by solution casting method for piezoelectric measurements.
Samples underwent DC poling at 65°C under a high electric field of 200 MV/m for 60 min prior to piezoelectric measurement.

reference_steps: 1.74 g PVDF was dissolved in 20 ml N,N-dimethylformamide at 60°C.
10-50 wt.% BCT3 filler was added to solution after four hours of PVDF mixing in DMF.
Solution was stirred at 500 rpm on hot plate for additional four hours to achieve homogeneous distribution.
Solution was cast in cleaned petri dish and annealed in oven at 100°C for 5 hours.
Films were peeled off from glass petri dish and cut into square pieces.
Films were hot pressed at 100°C by applying 125 kg/cm2 pressure for two hours.
Silver electrodes were painted on both sides of films and heated on hot plate for one hour.
Films were poled by applying DC electric field of 100 kV/cm for 1 hour before PE measurements.
test_steps: Dissolve 1.74 g of PVDF in 20 ml of N, N-dimethylformamide.
Maintain the solution temperature at 60 °C.
Mix PVDF in DMF for four hours.
Add 10, 20, 30, 40, and 50 wt.% of BCT3 filler to the solution.
Stir the solution at 500 rpm on a hot plate for an additional four hours.
Cast the solution in a cleaned petri dish.
Anneal the cast solution in an oven at 100 °C for 5 hours.
Peel off the obtained films from the glass petri dish.
Cut the films into square pieces.
Hot press the films at 100 °C by applying 125 kg/cm² pressure.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to chemical formula and adequately ball-milled for 24 h.
Powder was pre-fired in muffle furnace at 780°C for 4h at heating rate of 2°C/min.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol was added as binder and powder was pressed into 8 mm diameter disks at uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
Disks were sintered at ramp rate of 2°C/min for 3 h at 600°C to remove PVA.
Final sintering was conducted at 1000°C for 6 h to obtain ceramic wafers.
Ceramic discs with double-sided silver electrodes were polarized in silicon oil at 120°C under DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, Fe2O3, TiO2, BaCO3, nano-Al2O3, and ZnO were weighed according to the chemical formula.
The weighed materials were adequately ball-milled for 24 h.
The powder was pre-fired in a muffle furnace held at 780 °C for 4h at a heating rate of 2 °C/min.
8 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added as a binder.
A small amount of the powder was pressed into 8 mm diameter disks at a uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
These disks were sintered at a ramp rate of 2 °C/min for 3 h at 600 °C to remove the PVA.
The disks were further sintered at 1000 °C for 6 h to obtain ceramic wafers.
The ceramic discs with double-sided silver electrodes were polarized by placing them in silicon oil at 120 °C and holding them at a DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 min.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to chemical formula and mixed using conventional solid-state reaction method.
Powders were calcined at 900°C.
Materials were sintered at 1150°C to obtain ceramic samples.
Samples were prepared for electrical measurements by applying silver electrodes.
Ceramics were poled for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Elaboration of powders through a conventional solid-state reaction.
Calcination at 900 °C.
Sintering at 1150 °C.

reference_steps: Raw materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 r/min after weighing according to stoichiometry ratio.
Powders were dried in oven and calcined at 890°C for 6 h.
Powders were ball-milled again for 12 h.
Powder mixtures were dried, sieved, and pressed into pellets with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Pellets were sintered in ambient air using two-step sintering technology.
Temperature was raised to 1190°C with heating rate of 10°C/min, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 3-15 h.
Samples were placed in sealed crucible and covered with self-sourced powders to minimize volatilization losses.
Two sides of as-sintered samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min before piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Precursors were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 r/min after weighting according to the stoichiometry ratio.
Powders were dried in an oven.
Powders were calcined at 890 °C for 6 h.
Powders were ball-milled again for 12 h.
Powder mixtures were dried and sieved.
Powder mixtures were pressed into pellets with a diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using a cold isostatic press.
Pellets were sintered by raising the temperature to 1190 °C with a heating rate of 10 °C/min, then rapidly cooled down to 1090 °C and dwelled for 3–15 h before naturally cooled down.
Two sides of the as-sintered samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600 °C for 30 min to form the electrodes.

reference_steps: Raw materials were mixed and calcined at 700-875°C for 5 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled for 24 h at 250 rpm using planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls.
Calcined powders were filled into cylindric Molybdenum die covered with graphite foil.
Water (5 wt%) was added dropwise before upper punch insertion.
Force of 45 kN (400 MPa pressure) was applied for 40 min with gradual temperature increase of 5°C/min reaching 200°C.
Thermal post-treatment at 850°C for 25 min with lower pressure of 245 MPa and heating/cooling rate of 10°C/min in vacuum.
Samples were re-oxidized for 6 h at 850°C in oxygen to equilibrate point defects.
Both sides of polished pellets were coated with platinum via sputtering for electrical measurements.
DC poling at 2.5 kV/mm for 30 min at 120°C for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Mix K2CO3, Na2CO3, and Nb2O5.
Calcine the powder at temperatures ranging from 700 to 875 °C for 5 h.
Re-mill the calcined powder for 24 h at 250 rpm using a planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls.
Add water (5 % weight fraction) dropwise to the powder.
Apply a force of 45 kN (400 MPa) over 40 min, with a gradual temperature increase of 5 °C/min, reaching 200 °C (cold sintering step) using an SPS machine in vacuum.
Perform a thermal post-treatment at 850 °C for 25 min with a pressure of 245 MPa and a heating and cooling rate of 10 °C/min.
Re-oxidize samples for 6 h at 850 °C in oxygen.
Pole samples with a DC electric field of 2.5 kV/mm for 30 min at 120 °C.

reference_steps: Raw powders were weighed according to proportion of corresponding components.
Weighed materials and ethanol were poured into jar and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
Ball-milled powders were dried and calcined at 850°C for 6 h.
Raw powders were mixed according to proportion and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls again.
Dried mixed powders were granulated into floc with 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Powders were pressed into disks (1 mm thickness, 10 mm diameter) under pressure of 10 MPa.
After removing PVA, disks were buried in calcined powders and sintered at 1150°C for 3 h in air.
Heating rate was 5°C/min from RT to 1000°C, then 3°C/min beyond 1000°C.
Both sides of sintered samples were mechanically polished and brushed with silver layer.
Samples with silver electrodes were processed at 600°C for 10 min.
Poling process was carried out in silicone oil at room temperature under electric fields of 5 kV/mm for 3 min.
test_steps: Weighed raw materials (Bi2O3, Na2CO3, K2CO3, TiO2, Ta2O5, Sb2O5, ZrO2, HfO2) and ethanol are poured into a jar and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
The dried powders are calcined at 850 °C for 6 h.
The calcined powders are mixed according to the proportion of the corresponding components, and ethanol is poured into a jar and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
The dried mixed powders are granulated into a floc with 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder.
The granulated floc is pressed into disks (1 mm in thickness and 10 mm in diameter) under a pressure of 10 MPa.
PVA is removed from the disks.
The disks are buried in the calcined powders and sintered at 1150 °C for 3 h in an air atmosphere. The heating rate from RT to 1000 °C is 5 °C/min, and 3 °C/min beyond 1000 °C.
Samples with silver electrodes are processed at 600 °C for 10 min.
Poling process is carried out in silicone oil at room temperature under electric fields of 5 kV/mm for 3 min.

reference_steps: High-purity oxides were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Powders were ball-milled in ethanol medium with zirconia balls for 24 h.
After drying in oven, mixture was calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
Calcined powder underwent additional 12 h ball milling process in ethanol.
Powders were dried and granulated by adding 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol.
Mixture was sieved through 80-mesh screen to obtain uniform powder particles.
Samples were crafted by uniaxially dry pressing powder mixtures with diameter of 10 mm and thickness of 1.5 mm.
Binder was removed at 550°C.
Samples underwent sintering at rate of 3°C/min, reaching temperatures between 1120-1200°C for 2 h in ambient air.
Green discs were coated with identical powder to prevent evaporation of Pb and Bi.
Ag electrodes were applied on both surfaces and fired at 600°C for 15 min.
Ceramics were poled under electric field of 4 kV/mm at 120°C for 20 min in silicon oil.

test: Standard bipolar and remnant hysteresis measurements
extra_items: Standard bipolar and remnant hysteresis measurements

reference_steps: Water-soluble metal salts were used as starting materials for hydro-evaporation synthesis.
After evaporation at 80°C, formed precursor precipitates were additionally heated at same temperature for 30 min to dry completely.
Dry precursor precipitates were ground in agate mortar to obtain precursor powders.
Precursor powders were calcined at 650°C for 3 h in air.
Ceramic powders were pressed uniaxially at 880 MPa in 6 mm die.
Samples were sintered at various temperatures (780°C or 835°C) for 3 h in air to achieve optimal compositions and microstructures.
Ceramic samples were sliced to 200 μm thickness for electrical measurements.
Samples were electrically poled at different electric fields during 1 s soaking time at room temperature.
test_steps: Powders were synthesized by a hydro-evaporation method starting from water-soluble metal salts.
After evaporation at 80 °C, the formed precursor precipitates were additionally heated at the same temperature for 30 min to dry completely.
The precursor powders were calcined at 650 °C for 3 h in air.
As-obtained ceramic powders were pressed uniaxially at 880 MPa in a 6 mm die.
Sintered at 835 °C for three hours (for lanthanum-doped samples and BFO-Zr1) or 780 °C for three hours (for BFO and BFO-Zr0.2) to obtain appropriate microstructures.
Sample BFO-La15-Zr1 was sintered at 870 °C for 3 h to increase its grain growth and get greater AGS values.

reference_steps: 99.9% pure chemicals were weighed and mixed in stoichiometric ratio according to formula.
Lead loss during heat treatment was balanced with 6 wt% PbO in each composition.
Sintered powder was made fine in agate mortar.
Methanol was added as dispersing agent and left for 1 h to ensure uniform mixing.
PVA (5 wt%) was added as binder with PVA-to-ceramic powder weight ratio of 1:20.
Powder was pressed into pellets using uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa pressure for 3 min.
Calcination was repeated twice to achieve homogeneous and single-phase composition.
Sintering was carried out in air atmosphere at 1150°C for 4 h.
Flat surfaces of pellets were coated with gold and silver paint electrodes applied and heated at 600°C for 30 min.
Samples were poled using Belding & McLaren method by heating to 100-110°C in silicon oil and applying DC electric field of 20-30 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weighed and mixed raw powdered materials (PbO, BaCO3, Nb2O5, and Nd2O3) in stoichiometric ratio.
Balanced lead loss during heat treatment at 1250 °C for 2 h with 6 wt% of PbO in each composition.
Added methanol as a dispersing agent and left for 1 h for uniform mixing.
Added PVA (5 wt%) as a binder with a PVA-to-ceramic powder weight ratio of 1:20.
Pressed powder into pellets using a uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa for 3 min.
Sintered in an air atmosphere at 1150 °C for 4 h.
Heated the pellet as an electrode at 600 °C for half an hour after coating with gold and applying silver paints.

reference_steps: Analytical reagents were mixed in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol as solvent for 12 h.
Prepared powders were dried and calcined at 900°C.
Calcined powders were milled and dried again.
Powders were pressed into pellets using polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Pellets were fired at 600°C to remove binder.
Samples were subsequently sintered at 1070°C-1170°C for 6 h under ambient atmosphere.
Sintered ceramic specimens were polished and coated with silver electrodes on top and bottom surfaces.
Optimal sintered specimen with highest d33 was selected through experimental trials by adjusting sintering temperature.
Ceramic specimens were poled in silicone oil at 4 kV/mm for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Materials were mixed in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol as a solvent for 12 h.
The prepared powders were dried.
The powders were calcined at 900 °C.
The pellets were fired at 600 °C to remove the binder.
The pellets were subsequently sintered at 1070°C-1170 °C for 6 h under an ambient atmosphere.
The ceramic surfaces were polished and thermally etched.

method.reference: template grain growth (TGG) with solid-state reaction

reference_steps: High purity precursors were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and mixed by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h.
Mixed powders were calcined at 850°C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure.
Slurry was prepared by mixing KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with PVB binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Uniform slurry was tape casted to green tapes using doctor blade with thickness of 30-50 μm.
Green tapes were cut, stacked, and uniaxially pressed under 15 MPa at 70°C for 20 min.
Organic binder was removed at 600°C.
Samples were heated to 1190°C, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 10 h.
Final textured ceramics were obtained after controlled cooling.
test_steps: K2CO3, Na2CO3, Nb2O5, Sb2O3, CaCO3, ZrO2, Ag2O and Bi2O3 powders were weighted according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Mixed by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h.
Calcined at 850 °C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure.
Slurry was prepared by mixing the KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 (NN) templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with polyvinyl butyral (PVB) binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Uniform slurry was tape casted to green tapes using a doctor blade with a thickness of 30–50 µm.
After drying, the green tapes were cut, stacked, and uniaxially pressed under a pressure of 15 MPa at 70 °C for 20 min.
Organic binder was removed at 600 °C.
Samples were heated to 1190 °C.
Rapidly cooled to 1090 °C and dwelled for 10 h.

reference_steps: High-purity raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometry ratio of 0.957K0.48Na0.52Nb0.96Sb0.04O3-0.04Bi0.5Na0.5ZrO3-0.003CaZrO3.
Materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 rpm.
After drying, powders were divided into 4 batches and calcined at 800, 850, 900, and 950°C respectively.
Part of powders were pressed into compacts with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Residual powders were subjected to another ball-milling for 24 h and pressed into pellets under same conditions.
All pellets were sintered using two-step sintering technique - rapidly raised to 1190°C at 10°C/min heating rate.
Temperature was rapidly cooled down to 1090°C and dwelled for 5 h before natural cooling.
For electrical measurements, samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min and aged for 20 h before testing.
Starting materials were mixed in stoichiometric ratios for Ba1-xSrxTi0.92Zr0.08O3 formula with x = 0, 0.04, 0.08, 0.12, 0.16, 0.2 mol.
Materials were subjected to ball milling in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 h.
Mixture underwent drying and then fired at 1200°C for duration of 2 h.
After calcination, material was thoroughly blended with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Mixture was compacted into discs measuring 15 mm across and 1 mm thickness by applying pressure of 10 MPa.
Molded ceramics were placed in muffle furnace, ramped to 650°C at rate of 5°C/min and held for 2 h to eliminate PVA.
Samples were heated to 1400°C at 5°C/min and sintered in air for 3 h.
For electrical characterization, ceramic surfaces were uniformly coated with silver paste on both sides.
Silver paste was cured by heating at 600°C for 30 min.
Ceramics were immersed in silicone oil bath at 40°C and subjected to polarization with DC field of 30 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Starting materials (BaCO3, SrCO3, TiO2, and ZrO2) were mixed in stoichiometric ratios.
Mixture was subjected to ball milling in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 h.
The mixture underwent drying.
The dried mixture was fired at 1200 °C for 2 h (calcination).
After calcination, the material was thoroughly blended with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
The blended material was compacted into discs measuring 15 mm in across and 1 mm in thickness by applying a pressure of 10 MPa.
The molded ceramics were placed in a muffle furnace, ramped to 650 °C at a rate of 5 °C/min, and held for 2 h to eliminate PVA.
Followed by heating to 1400 °C at 5 °C/min and sintering in the air for 3 h.
For electrical characterization, the ceramic surfaces were first uniformly coated with silver paste on both sides using a screen.
The coated ceramics were then heated at 600 °C for 0.5 h to cure the paste.
Ultimately, the ceramics were immersed in a silicone oil bath at 40 °C.
The ceramics were subjected to polarization with a direct-current (DC) field of 30 kV/cm for 20 min.

Quasi-static d33 m (piezoelectric coefficient d33 measurement)

reference_steps: Raw materials were prepared for 0.725BiFe(1-x)ScxO3-0.275BaTiO3 ceramics with x = 0, 0.0025, 0.0050, 0.0075, 0.010, 0.015, 0.02.
Carbonates were dried in oven at 120°C for more than 2 h before use.
Raw materials were mixed by ball-milling machine in ethanol.
After drying, powder mixture was calcined twice at 800°C for 2 h.
Calcined powders were milled for 12 h and then pressed into disks with 12.7 mm diameter using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as binder.
Green compacts were first fired at 600°C to remove PVA binder.
Samples were sintered in ambient atmosphere at temperature range of 1000°C-1020°C for 2 h.
Sintered disks were subjected to mechanical polishing to obtain thickness of ~0.35 mm.
Gold electrodes were sputtered onto ceramic surfaces for electrical measurements.
Ceramics were polarized at 120°C in silicone oil bath under DC electric field ranging from 5 to 6 kV/mm for 15-20 min.
test_steps: Carbonates (BaCO3) were dried in an oven at 120 °C for more than 2 h.
Raw materials (Bi2O3, Fe2O3, Sc2O3, TiO2, BaCO3) were mixed by a ball-milling machine in ethanol.
After drying, the powder mixture was calcined twice at 800 °C for 2 h.
The calcined powders were milled for 12 h.
The milled powders were pressed into disks with 12.7 mm in diameter using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder.
The green compacts were first fired at 600 °C to remove the PVA binder.
The compacts were then sintered in ambient atmosphere at a temperature in the range of 1000 °C–1020 °C for 2 h.
The sintered disks were subjected to mechanical polishing to obtain a thickness of ~0.35 mm.
Gold electrodes were sputtered onto ceramic surfaces for electrical measurements.

reference_steps: 0.74 Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.26PbTiO3 (PMN-0.26 PT) single crystals were grown by modified Bridgman method.
As-grown single crystals were oriented by rotating XRD method.
[001]-oriented square slices were cut with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mm³.
Layer of Ni was covered on (001) plane crystal slices to enhance binding force between single crystal and electrode.
Au electrode was sputtered on crystal slices for poling and electrical performance measurement.
All samples were annealed at 600°C for 10 h and then air-cooled to room temperature.
Samples were placed at room temperature for 2 days to completely release internal stress.
For electrical measurements, samples were poled using direct current poling (DCP) or alternating current poling (ACP) procedures.
During poling processes, single crystals were immersed in silicon oil to avoid arcing breakdown.
Electrical performance was measured 24 h after poling considering aging effect of materials.
test_steps: Growth of 0.74 Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.26PbTiO3 (PMN-0.26 PT) single crystals by a modified Bridgeman method.
Orientation of as-grown single crystals by the rotating XRD method.
Cutting of [001]-oriented square slices with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mm³.
Covering a layer of Ni on the (001) plane crystal slices.
Sputtering Au electrode on the crystal slices for poling and electrical performance measurement.
Annealing all samples at 600 °C for 10 h.
Air-cooling samples to room temperature.
Placing samples at room temperature for 2 days to completely release internal stress.
Poling samples using Direct Current Poling (DCP) procedure at different electric fields with dwelling 5 min at 25 °C.

Poling samples using Alternating Current Poling (ACP) procedure: ACP signal generated by a Function Generator (Agilent 33320A) and amplified by a high-voltage amplifier (Trek Model 10/40A). Symmetry triangular wave chosen. Optimum conditions for ACP were 0.1 Hz, 14 kV/cm, and 5 loading cycles.

reference_steps: AlN thin films were deposited by DC reactive magnetron sputtering from 100 × 300 mm² Al target (99.99% purity) using N2 and Ar as process gases.
Layers were deposited on 0.80-inch single side polished (100)-oriented Si substrates.
Substrates were cleaned in ultrasonic cleaning system: 5 minutes in Decon neutracon solvent, 5 minutes in WashBryte solvent, 5 minutes in deionized water.
Substrates were dried under N2 flow and loaded into deposition system under residual pressure around 10⁻⁷ mbar.
Al target was cleaned in pure Ar (flow of 30 sccm) at 300 W for 10 min to remove oxygen contamination.
Target was conditioned for 5 min in reactive atmosphere (Ar/N2 plasma) to reach stable reactive conditions.
AlN thin films were deposited using magnetron powers of 70-400 W and Ar & N2 flows of 20-40 sccm.
All experiments were conducted at room temperature with deposition time set at two hours.
Samples were characterized for thickness, morphology, crystallinity, and piezoelectric properties after deposition.
Barium acetate, calcium acetate and tin acetate were added in 2-ethylhexanoic acid in stoichiometric ratio and dissolved by heating at 80°C until clear solution was obtained.
Desired stoichiometric quantity of C16H36O4Ti was mixed in the same solvent in separate beaker and then added to the previous solution.
Final solution was stirred and mixed for 1 h under continuous heating at 80°C.
Solution was dried to obtain BCST powder.
BCST powder was calcined at 1000°C for 4 h in muffle furnace.
Calcined powder was grinded in mortar pestle with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol solution until fine powder was obtained.
Pellets were prepared by compressing under 5 ton pressure.
Pellets were sintered at 1100°C and 1200°C for 5 h to get densified BCST ceramics samples.
test_steps: Barium acetate, calcium acetate and tin acetate were added in 2-ethylhexanoic acid in stoichiometric ratio and dissolved by heating the mixture at 80 ˚C until clear solution was obtained.
The desired stoichiometric quantity of C16H36O4Ti was mixed in the same solvent in separate beaker and then added to the previous solution.
The final solution was then stirred and mixed for 1 h under continuous heating at temperature 80 ˚C.
The solution was dried so as to obtain BCST powder.
The BCST powder was calcined at temperature 1000 ˚C for 4 h in muffle furnace.
The calcined powder was grinded in mortar pestle with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) solution until fine powder was obtained.
The pellets of the grinded powder were prepared by compressing under 5 ton pressure.
The pellets were sintered at two different temperatures 1100 and 1200 ˚C for 5 h.
The BCST pellets were polished and coated with silver paste on both parallel faces in order to make electrical contact.

reference_steps: Raw materials were accurately weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and subjected to milling in alcohol with zirconia balls for 12 hours.
Materials were dried and presintered at 750°C for 2 hours.
Calcined powder underwent additional ball-milling process lasting 24 hours.
Powders were mixed with 7 wt% polyvinyl alcohol and compressed into gray disks measuring 13 mm in diameter.
Prepared disks were sintered at temperatures ranging from 1180 to 1270°C in air for 3 hours.
Samples were polished and coated with silver as electrodes to facilitate electrical characterization.
Sodium acetate, strontium acetate, bismuth acetate, and barium acetate were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and added to ethylene glycol methyl ether and acetic acid solvents.
12 mol% excess sodium acetate and 2 mol% excess bismuth acetate were used to compensate for possible evaporation during high-temperature annealing.
Tetrabutyl titanate mixed with acetylacetone was added to the mixture of acetate.
Precursor solution was obtained after stirring the mixture at 80°C for one hour.
Solution concentration of 0.4 mol/L was achieved by adjusting the solvent content.
Solution was deposited on pretreated Pt/TiO2/SiO2/Si substrates by spin coating at 1500 r/min for 10 s and then 3000 r/min for 40 s.
Deposited film was placed in rapid thermal treatment furnace for pyrolysis at 150°C for 3 min and then at 410°C for 10 min.
Annealing process was conducted at 725°C for 3 min for crystallization.
Deposition and heating procedures were repeated 6 times to prepare thin films with designed thickness.
Au electrodes with diameter of 0.3 mm were prepared by DC sputtering.
test_steps: Weigh sodium acetate, strontium acetate, bismuth acetate, and barium acetate according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Add weighed precursors to solvents.
Use 12 mol% excess sodium acetate and 2 mol% excess bismuth acetate to compensate for possible evaporation.
Stir the mixture at 80°C for one hour to obtain the precursor solution of BNT-ST-100xBT.
Adjust solvent content to achieve a solution concentration of 0.4 mol/L.
Deposit BNT-ST-100xBT solution on pretreated Pt/TiO2/SiO2/Si substrates by spin coating.
Drop the solution onto the substrate.
Rotate the substrate at 1500 r/min for 10 s.
Rotate the substrate at 3000 r/min for 40 s to ensure uniform and complete coverage.
Place the deposited film in a rapid thermal treatment (RTP) furnace for heat treatment.
Perform pyrolysis at 150°C for 3 min to evaporate the solvent.
Perform pyrolysis at 410°C for 10 min to remove organic components.
Perform annealing at 725°C for 3 min for crystallization.
Repeat the deposition and heating procedures 6 times to achieve the designed thickness.
Prepare Au electrodes with a diameter of 0.3 mm onto the surface of thin films by DC sputtering.

reference_steps: Raw materials were precisely weighed on the basis of stoichiometric ratio and mixed in deionized water.
Materials were grounded for 6 h by ball-milling with ratio of materials to balls to water as 1:2:1.
Powder was pressed into blocks and calcined at 850°C for 2 hours.
Calcined powder was ball-milled for 12 hours again to obtain uniform PMS-PZT powder.
Dried powder combined with PVA binder was pressed into pellets of diameter 20 mm and thickness 1.4 mm at pressure of 7 MPa.
Green bodies were heated at 550°C for 3 h to remove the PVA.
Green bodies were sintered at 1250°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucible with same composition powder on surface to minimize PbO evaporation.
Sintered ceramics were ground into thickness of 1 mm.
Silver electrodes were fired on top and bottom surfaces at 720°C for 20 min.
Ceramics were poled in silicon oil at 130°C for 40 minutes under DC electric field of 35 kV/mm.
Polarized ceramics were aged for at least 24 hours at room temperature before testing.
test_steps: Precisely weigh raw materials based on stoichiometric ratio.
Mix all materials in deionized water and grind for 6 h by ball-milling (material:balls:water ratio 1:2:1).
Press the ball-milled powder into blocks.
Calcined at 850 ℃ for 2 hours.
Ball-mill the calcined powder for 12 hours again to obtain uniform PMS-PZT powder.
Combine dried powder with binders PVA (polyvinyl alcohol).
Press into pellets of a diameter of 20 mm and a thickness of 1.4 mm at a pressure of 7 MPa.
Heat green bodies at 550 ℃ for 3 h to remove PVA.
Sinter green bodies at 1250 ℃ for 2 h in a sealed alumina crucible with the same composition powder in the surface of the disks to minimize the evaporation of PbO.
Cool down.
Grind sintered ceramics into a thickness of 1 mm.
Fire silver electrodes on the top and bottom surfaces of the ceramics at 720℃ for 20 min.
Pole ceramics in silicon oil at 130 ℃ for 40 minutes under an DC electric field of 35 kV/mm.
Age polarized ceramics for at least 24 hours at room temperature.

reference_steps: Raw powders were weighed according to stoichiometric formulae and ball milled for 24 h in polypropylene containers with ethanol and ZrO2 balls using planetary milling machine.
After drying the mixture, first calcination process was carried out at 850°C for 2 h to prevent volatilization of Bi3+.
Second calcination cycle was conducted at 900°C for 4 h.
Calcined powder was re-milled for 24 h and thermally treated in additional two-stage calcination process at 950°C for 4 h, followed by calcination at 1000°C for 2 h.
Obtained powder was milled again for 4 h to homogeneously reduce particle size.
Powder was mixed with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder in mortar and uniaxial cold-pressed into pellets with diameter of 12 mm.
Pellets were covered with powder of same composition and sintered at 1100°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucibles.
Calcination and sintering processes were performed at heating rate of 5°C/min.
Drying procedures were carried out at 120°C on hot plate for 12 h.
test_steps: Weighing raw powders according to stoichiometric formulae.
Thoroughly ball milling for 24 h in polypropylene containers with ethanol and ZrO2 balls using a planetary milling machine.
First calcination at 850°C for 2 h.
Second calcination at 900°C for 4 h.
Re-milling calcined powder for 24 h.
Additional two-stage calcination at 950°C for 4 h, followed by calcination at 1000°C for 2 h.
Milling obtained powder again for 4 h to homogeneously reduce the particle size.
Mixing powder with a binder (5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol) in a mortar.
Uniaxial cold-pressing into pellets with a diameter of 12 mm.
Covering pellets with powder of the same composition.
Sintering at 1100°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucibles (heating rate of 5°C/min for calcination and sintering).
Drying procedures at 120°C on a hot plate for 12 h.

reference_steps: Weighed chemicals were wet-milled in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 h in ethanol.
Materials were calcined at 750°C for 3 hours.
Calcined powders were milled, dried, ground, and granulated with polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Granulated powders were pressed into discs with diameters of 12.5 mm and thicknesses of 1.0 mm at pressure of 150 MPa.
Pellets were heated to 650°C for 60 min to burn out the binder.
Samples were sintered at 1080°C for 3 h.
Sintered samples were polished to thickness of approximately 0.5 mm.
Silver paste was screen-printed onto two parallel polished surfaces, followed by firing at 570°C for 30 min.
test_steps: Weighed chemicals were wet-milled in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 h in ethanol.
Calcination at 750 °C for 3 hours.
Calcined powders were milled, dried, ground, and granulated with a polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Granulated powders were pressed into discs with diameters of 12.5 mm and thicknesses of 1.0 mm at a pressure of 150 MPa.
Pellets were heated to 650 °C for 60 min to burn out the binder.
Samples were sintered at 1080 °C for 3 h.
Sintered samples were polished to a thickness of approximately 0.5 mm.

reference_steps: Precursors were dried for minimum of 12 hours in 120°C drying oven prior to planetary ball milling.
Ball milling was conducted in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 3 h at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 250 μm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Three individual calcination pellets with nominal weight of 3.0 g and diameter of 25 mm were uniaxially pressed under 5 MPa.
Calcination pellets were calcined in partially closed alumina crucible at 801.5°C for 4 hours with heating rate of 3°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
Following calcination, pellets were milled in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 30 minutes at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 150 μm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Approximately 24 sintering pellets with nominal weight of 0.30 g and diameter of 10 mm were uniaxially pressed under 30 MPa.
Pellets were isostatically pressed under 200 MPa with dwell time of one minute.
Pellets were sintered in batches of 3 in partially closed alumina crucible at 1103.5°C for 2 hours with heating rate of 5°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
test_steps: Precursors dried for a minimum of 12 hours in a 120 °C drying oven.
Ball milling conducted in 100 % ethanol with a 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 3 h at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry dried using a rotary evaporator.
Ground with an agate mortar and pestle.
Sieved with a 250 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Three individual calcination pellets (3.0 g, 25 mm diameter) uniaxially pressed under 5 MPa in a stainless-steel die.
Calcination took place in a muffle furnace at 801.5 °C for 4 hours with a heating rate of 3 °C/min and a cooling rate of approximately 4 °C/min.
Following calcination, pellets milled in 100 % ethanol with a 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 30 minutes at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry dried using a rotary evaporator.
Ground with an agate mortar and pestle.
Sieved with a 150 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Approximately 24 sintering pellets (0.30 g, 10 mm diameter) uniaxially pressed under 30 MPa in a stainless-steel die.
Pellets then isostatically pressed under 200 MPa with a dwell time of one minute.
Pellets sintered in batches of 3 in a partially closed alumina crucible with sacrificial powder.
Sintering took place in a muffle furnace at 1103.5 °C for 2 hours with a heating rate of 5 °C/min and a cooling rate of approximately 4 °C/min.
Sintered pellets prepared to a 1 µm surface finish (silicon carbide paper to 5 µm, polycrystalline diamond paste to 1 µm).
Some pellets thermally etched (1037.5 °C for 7 minutes; heating rate 5 °C/min).
All SEM/EDX specimens carbon coated (approximately 20 nm thickness).

reference_steps: Powders were precisely weighed according to stoichiometric ratios and transferred to nylon tube for 12 h of ball milling in alcohol dispersing medium.
Mixed slurry was dried and calcined at 850°C for 4 h.
Calcined powder was subsequently milled again for 12 h.
0.3 g of ceramic powder was pressed into disc with diameter of 8 mm and thickness of 1.3 mm under pressure of 250 MPa.
Surface of green bodies was covered with ceramic powder of same composition and sintered in air at 1100°C for 4 h to obtain dense ceramic sheets.
Samples were polished to required thickness and platinum electrodes were applied and cured on both sides.
Samples were polarized in silicone oil bath at 180°C under electric field of 160-200 kV/cm for 30 min.
test_steps: Precisely weigh powders according to stoichiometric ratios.
Transfer powders to a nylon tube for 12 h of ball milling in an alcohol dispersing medium.
Dry the mixed slurry.
Calcination at 850 °C for 4 h.
Mill again for 12 h.
Press 0.3 g of ceramic powder into a disc with a diameter of 8 mm and a thickness of 1.3 mm under a pressure of 250 MPa.
Cover the surface of green bodies with ceramic powder of the same composition.
Sinter in air at 1100 °C for 4 h to obtain dense ceramic sheets.

extra_keys: P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 - corona-poled ES1A-2800 min in air

reference_steps: Nonwoven ES fiber mats of P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 were prepared from 12 wt% methyl ether ketone solution using electrospinning equipped with grounded rolling collector.

First thermal annealing (1A) process was performed by holding ES fiber mat isothermally at 140°C for various times (10, 60, 180, 360, 720, 1440, and 2880 min) to produce ECCs via chain-sliding motions in paraelectric phase.
Second annealing (2A) was carried out for ES1A-2880 min below TC with fixed isothermal time of 1 day at temperatures of 110, 115, 125, and 130°C to further increase ferroelectric domain size.
Corona-charging was employed to achieve permanent remanent polarization for piezoelectricity.
For corona-poling in water, methanol was used to wet fiber mats first and then replaced with water.
AC corona poling at 500 kHz was performed in water to avoid formation of ionic EDLs and potential electrolytic degradation.
After corona-poling in water, samples were dried in vacuum before characterization.
test_steps: Prepare nonwoven ES fiber mats of P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 from 12 wt% methyl ether ketone (MEK) solution using electrospinning equipped with a grounded rolling collector.
Apply multi-step thermal annealing processes to achieve ECCs with thickened ferroelectric domains.
Employ corona-charging to achieve permanent remanent polarization (Pr0) for piezoelectricity.

First thermal annealing (1A) process: Hold the ES fiber mat isothermally at 140 °C for various times (10, 60, 180, 360, 720, 1440, and 2880 min) to produce ECCs via chain-sliding motions in the paraelectric phase.

Second annealing (2A) process: Carry out for ES1A-2880 min below TC with a fixed isothermal time of 1 day at temperatures of 110, 115, 125, and 130 °C to further increase the ferroelectric domain size.
For corona-poling in air: Pole the fiber mats with corona-poling in air at room temperature for 30 min, with the distance between the high-voltage probe and the fiber mat not shorter than 2 cm.
To eliminate self-polarized Pr0 in as-electrospun fiber mats: Thermally anneal samples at 140 °C for 60 min under a short-circuit condition.
For corona-poling in water: Use AC corona poling at 500 kHz with a probe-to-fiber mat distance of 0.5 cm. After corona-poling, dry the fiber mats in vacuum.

method.reference: mixed oxide method with composite fabrication
method.test: Mixed oxide method, Cut and fill method

reference_steps: BZT powder was prepared by calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide and titanium dioxide at 1200°C for 2 h using mixed oxide method.
BZT powder was pressed into disc shape of ~15 mm diameter and thickness of ~1.5 mm at applied pressure of ~85 MPa.
BZT discs were sintered at 1450°C for 2 h.
BZT discs (dimension ~12 mm and thickness ~1.5 mm) were poled using electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50°C for 30 min in silicone oil chamber.
Poled BZT ceramic was cut using diamond saw in parallel direction along polarization axis using cut and fill method.
Mixtures of Portland cement powder, water (w/c ratio 0.35), epoxy resin and hardener (volume ratio 7.5) were prepared as matrix phase.
Mixture was filled into cut areas of BZT ceramic to create 1-3 connectivity composites with 40, 50, and 60 vol% BZT and 0, 3, 5, and 7 vol% epoxy resin.
Samples were cured in controlled chamber at 60°C for 5 days at 98% RH.
test_steps: BZT (BaZr0.05Ti0.95O3) powder was prepared using the mixed oxide method by calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide, and titanium dioxide at 1200 °C for 2 h.
BZT powder was pressed into a disc shape of ~15 mm diameter and a thickness of ~1.5 mm with an applied pressure of ~85 MPa.
BZT discs were sintered at 1450 °C for 2 h.
BZT discs (dimension ~12 mm and thickness ~1.5 mm) were poled using an electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50 °C for 30 min in a silicone oil chamber.
Poled BZT ceramic was cut using a diamond saw in a parallel direction along with the polarization axis (cut and fill method).
Mixtures of Portland cement powder, water (water to cement ratio (w/c) = 0.35), epoxy resin, and hardener (volume ratio of epoxy resin and hardener = 7.5) were used as the matrix phase.
The mixture was filled into the cut areas of the BZT ceramic.
The samples were then cured in a controlled chamber at 60 °C for 5 days at 98 %RH.

reference_steps: Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 powders were wet-mixed via ball milling for 12 h, followed by calcination at 1050°C for 6 h to obtain precursor ScNbO4.
Precursors were mixed with PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, MnO2, and Sb2O3 before being calcined at 850°C for 2 h to achieve desired composition of PZT-PMS-PSN.
Resultant powder was crushed for 8 h and then dried.
Fine powder was mixed with PVA binder at mass concentration of 7% and pressed to form Φ10mm pellets at pressure of 150 MPa.
After binder was cremated at 800°C for 2 h, PZT-PMS-PSN samples were sintered at 1180°C for 2 h.
Sintered pellets were polished to reach about 0.5 mm thickness.
Both sides of sample were coated with silver paste and fired at 800°C for 10 min for electrical property measurements.
Samples were polarized for 30 min at 180°C in silicone oil bath at DC field strength of 5 kV/mm for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 powders were wet-mixed via ball milling for 12 h.
Calcination of wet-mixed Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 at 1050 °C for 6 h to obtain the precursor ScNbO4.
The precursors (ScNbO4) were mixed with PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, MnO2, and Sb2O3.
Calcination of the mixture at 850 °C for 2 h to achieve the desired composition of PZT-PMS-PSN.
The resultant powder was crushed for 8 h.
The crushed powder was dried.
The fine powder was mixed with PVA binder at a mass concentration of 7 %.
The mixture was pressed to form Φ10mm pellets at a pressure of 150 MPa.
The binder was cremated at 800 °C for 2 h.
The PZT-PMS-PSN samples were sintered at 1180 °C for 2 h.
The sintered pellets were polished to reach about 0.5 mm.
Both sides of the sample were coated with silver paste.
The silver-coated samples were fired at 800 °C for 10 min.
Polarization of samples at 180 °C in a silicone oil bath at a DC field strength of 5kv mm⁻¹ for 30 min.
The powder was compacted into a bulk of dimensions of 15 mm × 2 mm × 2 mm.
The specimens were poled along the thickness direction.

reference_steps: Raw ingredients were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and wet milled for 24 hours in ethanol medium using polyethylene bottles containing yttria-stabilized zirconia balls.
Milled precursors were dried in oven at 80°C overnight.
Dried powder was calcined at 1200°C for 4 hours in zirconia crucible.
Calcined powder was thoroughly ground in agate mortar to minimize particles and preserve appropriate homogeneity.
Combined powders were pelletized into disc-shaped samples using 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Sintering was carried out for 4 hours at 1450°C at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
Sintered pellets were polished on silicon carbide paper.
Pellets were coated with silver paint on both sides and dried for 30 minutes at 600°C to facilitate electrical measurement.
test_steps: Weigh each powder in stoichiometric ratio.
Wet mill the mixture for 24 hours in ethanol medium using polyethylene bottles containing yttria-stabilized zirconia balls.
Dry the milled precursors in an oven at 80 °C overnight.
Calcined the dried precursors at 1200 °C for 4 hours in a zirconia crucible.
Pelletize the combined powders into disc-shaped samples using a 5 wt.% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Sinter the pellets for 4 hours at 1450 °C at a heating rate of 2 °C per minute.
Polish the sintered pellets on silicon carbide paper.
Coat pellets with silver paint on both sides.
Dry the coated pellets for 30 minutes at 600 °C.
Pole the ceramics under DC voltage equal to their coercive field for 30 minutes at room temperature in a silicon oil bath.

reference_steps: In2Se3@SnSe S-scheme heterojunction piezo-photocatalysts were prepared using two-step hydrothermal method.
SnSe displays typical nanoplate morphology while In2Se3 exhibits nanosheet structure.
Chemical reaction involving Se in SnSe produces In2Se3 during heterojunction formation.
All In2Se3@SnSe heterojunctions exhibit flower-like spherical structure.
Varying molar content of SnSe was used to create different compositions (In2Se3@SnSe-1, In2Se3@SnSe-2, In2Se3@SnSe-3, In2Se3@SnSe-4).
Heterojunction formation results in interfacial interaction and electron transfer from SnSe to In2Se3.
test_steps: In2Se3 and SnSe were combined to form In2Se3@SnSe heterojunctions.
The molar content of SnSe was varied to observe its effect on the heterojunction formation.

reference_steps: Raw materials were accurately weighed according to composition (1-x)(Ba0.95Ca0.05)(Ti0.89Sn0.11)O3-xBiFeO3 and milled with ethanol for 16 h.
After drying at 100°C, powders were calcined at 1150°C for 3 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled with ethanol for 16 h.
Powders were pressed into disks of 9 mm diameter using 3% PVA solution as binder.
Green bodies were fired at 600°C for 2 h and then sintered at 1400°C for 3 h.
Sintered ceramics were polished and coated with silver paste on top and bottom surfaces.
Silver-coated ceramics were fired at 800°C for 30 min to obtain electrodes.
Coated ceramics were poled at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 min at room temperature in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Accurately weigh raw materials according to the composition (1-x) (Ba0.95Ca0.05) (Ti0.89Sn0.11)O3-xBiFeO3.
Mill the weighed powders with ethanol for 16 h.
Dry the powders at 100 °C.
Calcined the powders at 1150 °C for 3 h.
Re-mill the calcined powders with ethanol for 16 h.
Press the powders into disks of 9 mm in diameter using 3% PVA solution as a binder.
Fire the disks at 600 °C for 2 h.
Sinter the disks at 1400 °C for 3 h.
Polish the sintered ceramics.
Coat the top and bottom surfaces of the ceramics with silver paste.
Fire the coated ceramics at 800 °C for 30 min to obtain an electrode.
Pole the coated ceramics at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 min at room temperature in a silicone oil bath.

reference_steps: Li-doped BaTiO3 ceramics were synthesized with varying weight percentages of Li (0 wt%, 2 wt%, and 4 wt%) using solvothermal approach
Powders were pressed into pellets for dielectric measurements
Pellets were sintered in closed environment at 1100°C for 2 hours
Care was taken to minimize lithium loss during sintering by covering samples with crucibles
test_steps: Li-doped BaTiO3 ceramics were synthesized with varying weight percentages of Li (0 wt%, 2 wt%, and 4 wt%) using the solvothermal approach.
For dielectric measurements, the powders were pressed.
The pellets were sintered in a closed environment at 1100 °C for 2 h.

reference_steps: Stoichiometric ratios of high-purity precursors BaCO3, CaCO3, ZrO2, SnO2, and TiO2 were mixed.
Combinations were ground for 2 hours in mortar and pestle.
Materials were ball milled for 4 hours in ethanol solution with zirconia balls in low-energy ball mill.
Resulting solutions were dried and obtained lumps were pulverized.
Powders were calcined for 4 hours at 1200°C in air ambient.
Resulting granulated powders were reground.
1 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added as organic binder.
Materials were molded into disk-shaped pellets (1 mm thick and 10 mm diameter).
Pellets were heated for 1 hour at 650°C at rate of 1°C per minute to burn off PVA binder.
Binder-free pellets underwent sintering for 4 hours at 1400°C in air.
Sintered pellets were electroded on opposite faces with conducting silver paste for electrical measurements.
Mixed 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2.
Subjected mixture to ball milling for 15 h at rotational speed of 300 rpm.
Added 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution to mixture and ball-milled for additional 3 min at same speed.
Transferred resulting mixture onto silicon carbide plate (3 cm × 2 cm).
Evaporated ammonia solution by heating plate on hot plate set to 150°C.
Placed SiC plate with residual mixture into tubular furnace.
Gradually increased furnace temperature to 1300°C and maintained for 3 h under continuous NH3 gas flow.
Stopped NH3 gas flow at 975°C upon completion of reaction.
Allowed furnace to cool to room temperature.
Carefully removed composite material from SiC plate for characterization.
test_steps: 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2 were mixed.
The mixture was subjected to ball milling for 15 h at a rotational speed of 300 rpm.
2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution was added to the mixture.
The mixture was then ball-milled for an additional 3 min at the same rotational speed.
The resulting mixture was transferred onto a silicon carbide plate (3 cm × 2 cm).
The ammonia solution was evaporated by heating the plate on a hot plate set to 150 °C.
The SiC plate with the residual mixture was placed into a tubular furnace.
The furnace temperature was gradually increased to 1300 °C and maintained for 3 h under a continuous flow of NH3 gas.
Upon completion of the reaction, the NH3 gas flow was stopped at 975 °C.
The furnace was allowed to cool to room temperature.

reference_steps: Raw materials CeO2, Bi2O3, TiO2, and Nb2O5 were weighed according to BTN-100xCe nominal composition.
Materials were ball mixed for 24 hours with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium.
Mixed slurries were separated from balls and dried.
Dried materials were calcined at 800°C for 3 hours.
Calcined materials were ball milled for 24 hours again and dried.
Dried powders were granulated with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol solution as adhesive.
Granulated powders were pressed into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thick under 120±10 MPa pressure.
Green pellets were fired at 650°C for 3 hours to burn off PVA.
Pellets were sintered at 1065-1105°C for 3 hours in air with 5°C/min heating rate.
Sintered samples were furnace-cooled to ambient temperature.
test_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to BTN-100xCe nominal composition.
Raw materials were ball mixed for 24 h with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium.
After separating the balls, the mixed slurries were dried.
Mixed slurries were calcined at 800 °C for 3 h.
Calcined powders were ball milled for 24 h again.
The dried powders were granulated by polyvinyl alcohol solution (PVA, 5 wt%) as adhesive.
Granulated powders were pressed into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and about 1.0 mm thick under a pressure of 120 ± 10 MPa.
The green pellets were fired at 650 °C for 3 h to burn off the PVA.
The green pellets were sintered at 1065 °C–1105 °C for 3 h in air with 5 °C/min.
Sintered pellets were furnace-cooled to ambient temperature.
Sintered pellets were parallel polished on both sides to about 0.6 mm thick.
Polished pellets were painted with silver paste.
Painted pellets were fired for 30 min at 800 °C to form electrodes.
For piezoelectric measurements, the ceramic samples were poled at 160 °C for 20–30 min in silicone oil bath applied with an electric field of 100~150 kV/cm.

reference_steps: Raw materials Ba(CH3COO)2, Ca(NO3)2·4H2O, Zr(NO3)4·5H2O, Ti(OC4H9)4 and La(NO3)3·nH2O were added to an Erlenmeyer flask to gain a polymer solution.
Solution was placed in the oven at 120°C for 10 h to obtain gels.
Gels were calcined at 900°C for 2 h to form precursor powders.
Powders were pressed into disks with a diameter of 20 mm.
Disks were embedded in alumina.
Disks were sintered at 1300°C for 4 h in air with a heating rate of 5°C/min.
Ceramic samples were obtained.
test_steps: The solution was placed in the oven at 120 °C for 10 h to obtain gels.
The gels were calcined at 900 °C for 2 h to form precursor powders.
The powders were pressed into disks with a diameter of 20 mm and the disks were embedded in alumina.
The disks were sintered at 1300 °C for 4 h in air with a heating rate of 5 °C/min.
